Con los 3,000 nuevos soles, podrá  comprar plantas de cacao para poder incrementar en su parcela y con el resto comprará abono.
texts.en: Teodora is 35 years old, she lives in her own home with her husband, Sixto, who is 42 years old, and their 4 beloved children, whom she hopes to give a better quality of life. She makes a living as a farmer as well as cares for her home. With the support of her husband and her children she is able to cultivate and harvest her cacao and coffee plants. With 23 years of experience she knows that there will be difficulties, but that you have to deal with them. Teodora told us that since the time that she began working with MFP the services they offer have been very helpful because with their support she has been able to increase her production. This will be her 7th loan with MFP and she has committed to making her payments on time. She is a very responsible member of her communal bank. With the 3,000 Nuevos Soles she will be able to buy cacao plants to increase her plot of land and with the rest she will buy fertilizer.

loans.use: to buy cacao plants and bags of fertilizer.

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.es: Lourdes, de 29 años, es una joven soltera, vive en su propia casa; donde esmera dar lo mejor de sí misma para obtener un buen futuro. Lourdes, es una mujer muy activa y persiste en realizar los objetivos que se propone para obtener una buena estadía. Lourdes se dedica a labrar la tierra para después cultivar cacao, productos que son rentables en la localidad de Palmapampa.  En tiempos de cosecha cuenta con el apoyo de peones para poder extraer rápido los frutos. Sin embargo considera difícil las temporadas de lluvia ya que no puede elaborar el mantenimiento correspondiente; como fumigando y quitar las malezas que llegan a crecer entre sus plantaciones y a veces no cuenta con suficiente economía para evitar los daños que causan mala cosecha de su producción. Por tal motivo acude a los bancos de MFP para solicitar un préstamo que ayude con sus problemas. Este será su crédito numero 02 con MFP, está dispuesta a realizar sus pagos puntualmente. En sus banco comunal es responsable con las actividades que realizan. Con los 1,000 nuevos soles, podrá contratar peones para que le ayuden a desyerbar la maleza que aquejan sus plantas.
texts.en:
29-year old Lourdes is single and lives in her own house. She is willing to go to a lot of trouble to obtain a better future for herself. She is energetically pursuing whatever needs to be done to achieve her objectives.

Lourdes works in the fields growing cocoa, a product that brings in a good income in the Palmapampa area. At harvest time she hires labourers to help her pick the cocoa quickly. The rainy season poses a problem as she cannot look after the fields as well as she would like; spreading insecticide and weeding between the plants are difficult to do then. Sometimes she cannot afford the supplies necessary to avoid a bad harvest. 

For these reasons Lourdes has approached MFP for help with her problems. This will be her second loan with MFP. She promises to make the repayments punctually. She is a responsible member of her community bank. With the S/.1000 loan Lourdes will contract labourers to help her weed the afflicted plants.

loans.use: to hire labourers

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John, 39 years old, is a mixed crop farmer. He is married to Susan, also a farmer, and they are blessed with two children. He has farmed for the past ten years, earning 7,000 KES a month, and uses his income to support his family.

John is applying for a third loan after repaying his previous two loans successfully. He will use the 43,000 KES to buy fertilizer and seedlings for his farm.

With the anticipated profits from his farm he will educate his children. His hopes and dreams are to buy a piece of land and build rental houses.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seedlings for his farm.

loans.name: Marcelo

texts.es: Marcelo, de 42 años, es un hombre trabajador y empeñoso, vive en su propi casa dedicándose a obtener un buen estado de vida. El señor Marcelo se dedica al trabajo de la agricultura, a pesar de estar solo siempre madruga para dirigirse a su parcela donde tiene cultivado plantas de cacao, lleva 23 años elaborando la producción de cacao y en tiempos de cosecha ve los resultados de todo el empeño que pone desde el momento que lo llegó a cultivar hasta el día de su cogida. Marcelo, considera que lo más difícil es no poder combatir con los animales que afectan a sus plantas; por lo que disminuye sus frutos; es por eso que acude a las oficinas de MFP, para poder solicitar un préstamo que ayude a tener buena producción. Este será su crédito número 09 con MFP, está agradecido con el apoyo financiero y en su banco comunal aconseja ser muy puntual ya que con el tiempo se puede solicitar otro préstamo. Con los 2,500 nuevos soles, podrá comprar abono e insecticidas para fumigar sus plantas de cacao.
texts.en:
42-year old Marcelo is a very hardworking man. He lives in his own house and is very keen to obtain a better standard of living. He works in agriculture. In spite of being alone, he gets up early to go to his fields where he grows cocoa plants. He’s been doing this work for 23 years. At harvest time he can see the results of all his efforts from the time of planting out to the day when he picks the cocoa. 

In Marcelo’s opinion the most difficult part of his work is dealing with the insects that attack the plants as they reduce his harvest. For this reason he has approached MFP for a loan to help him achieve better production. This will be his ninth loan. He is very grateful for this financial assistance. He advises his fellow community bank members to be punctual with repayments as they may wish to get further loans. With the S/.2,500 loan, Marcelo will be able to buy fertilizer and insecticide for his cocoa plants.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and insecticide for his cocoa plants

loans.name: Eric

texts.en:
Eric is 48 years old and married. He has five children aged between one and sixteen years old and takes care of six relatives as well.

Eric has been a tailor for 32 years. He works from 7:30 a.m. to 7:00 p.m. during the week, and he currently employs two people to help him.

Eric has requested a 500,000 RWF loan through Kiva’s partner Vision Finance Company to buy a new sewing machine. With his profits he can save for his future, renovate his own house and reinvest in his business.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine.

loans.name: Ann

texts.en:
Ann, 26 years old, has been rearing pigs in Nakuru for the last year. She is married to Leonard and together they are blessed with three children.

Ann was introduced to KADET LTD by one of our existing clients and this will be her first loan. She plans to use it to buy more  pigs to rear and later sell at a profitable price. This will enable her to make more income and improve her family's living standards. In the future, Ann hopes to invest more in her business and to be able to invest in other businesses.

loans.use: To buy pigs

loans.name: Regina

texts.en:
Regina, 38 years old, is married to Ephantus and they have three children. She has operated a business selling herbal medicine for the past seven years.

Regina was brought to KADET LTD by a client. This is her first term loan in KADET LTD and she will use it to purchase more stock of herbal medicines to sell. Regina's hope is to venture into the real estate business.

loans.use: to buy more stock of herbal medicines to sell

loans.name: Reyna

texts.es: Reyna, de 46 años, es una mujer responsable, vive en su propia casa junto a su esposo Paulino, de 42 años y sus 06 queridos hijos; quienes son el motivo se todo su esfuerzo. Reyna, es una mujer bastante ocupada con los deberes del hogar y de su chacra, recibe la ayuda de su esposo y el apoyo de sus hijos. Reyna desde hace más de 28 años que lleva cavando la tierra para luego cultivar plantas de cacao. Los tiempos en realiza el mantenimiento y cosecha son de arduo trabajo es por ello que en esos tiempos acude a sus vecinos para que le apoyen en sus labores. Con el tiempo su mayor anhelo es poder contar con buena economía para ayudar en los gastos de sus hijos ya que son estudiantes; al igual que desea en aumentar su producción. Este será su crédito número 07 con MFP, una vez más agradece el apoyo de los financistas y seguirá cumpliendo con sus cuotas de pago. En su banco comunal es una socia colaboradora en las opiniones. Con los 3,000 nuevos soles, podrá comprar plantas de cacao para incrementar en su parcela y con el resto comprará fungicidas para fumigar sus plantas.
texts.en: Reyna, 46 years old, is a responsible person who lives in her own house, along with her husband, Paulino, 42 years old, and their 6 beloved children. They are the motivation for all their hard work. Reina is very busy with the household tasks and with her farm plot. She has help from her husband and the support of her children. For more than 28 years Reyna has been farming the land, cultivating cacao plants. The time she spends in maintaining the crop and harvesting is arduous hard work, so in these times she turns to her neighbors so they can help her with the work. With time, her greatest wish is to be able to count on a good economy to help her with her children’s expenses because they are students. She also wants to increase her production. This will be her 7th loan with Microfinanzas Prisma. She is again grateful to the lenders and she will continue making her repayments. In her communal bank, she is supportive of other’s opinions.  With the 3,000 nuevos soles (PEN), she will buy cacao plants to increase the number on her parcel, and with the rest she will buy fungicides for fumigating her plants.

loans.use: to buy cacao plants and fungicides.

loans.name: Oretha

texts.en:
Oretha, 41, lives in Compound #3 and is married to a social worker. They have six children between the ages of five and 21, all of whom are in school.

For the past twenty years Oretha has run a small restaurant where she sells water, soft drinks and cooked food, a business she enjoys. She is requesting a 12,000 LRD loan to purchase soft drinks and water, plus rice, pepper, onion, oil and charcoal to prepare her food to sell.

Her plan is to establish a rubber tree farm for her children.

loans.use: to purchase food and drink for her restaurant.

loans.name: Jecinta

texts.en: Jecinta, 53 years old, is married and blessed with 10 children whom she supports. She has practiced mixed farming in Narok for the last 30 years. Jecinta's monthly income is KES 30,000. She will use her second loan of KES 45,000 from KADET LTD to buy farm inputs for better crop yields and to do land preparation. The anticipated profits will be used to support her business. Jecinta's dream for the future is to have a stable business

loans.use: To purchase farm inputs

loans.name: Walter

texts.es:
Walter, de 27 años, vive junto a su pareja Deisy de 30 años quienes esperan tener un buen futuro gracias a los esfuerzos que ambos tienen.
Hace 12 años que Walter se dedica a labrar la tierra para luego cultivar plantas de cacao, que gracias al esmero y dedicación hoy tiene su propia chacra. En tiempos de cosecha cuenta con la ayuda de jornaleros, de esa forma poder extraer rápido sus frutos para luego llevarlas a comercializar a los centros de acopio ubicado en la ciudad de San Francisco. Sin embargo le resulta difícil el transportar su cosecha desde la chacra hasta las empresas acopiadoras. Por ahora lo que mas prioriza es  hacer crecer mas sus plantaciones. Este será su crédito número 05 con MFP, por el cual se compromete a cumplir con sus respectivas obligaciones, además agradece la confianza que lo esta brindando su grupo comunal.
Con los 1,000 nuevos soles, comprará fertilizantes químicos para mantenerlas en buen cuidado a su plantación.
texts.en: Walter is 27 years old and lives with his wife, Deisy, who is 30 years old. They hope to have a good future together, thanks to both of their efforts. For the past 12 years Walter has made a living working the land to cultivate cacao plants. As a result of much care and dedication he now has his own small farm. During harvest times he has the support of hired workers, which allows him to pick the beans quickly so that later he can take them to warehouses located in San Francisco to sell them. It is difficult for him to transport his product from his land to the businesses where he sells. For now his highest priority is to increase his production. This will be his 5th loan with MFP, with which he promises to make his payments on time. He is thankful for the trust that his communal bank group has provided. With the 1.000 Nuevos Soles he will buy chemical fertilizers to maintain his crops in good care.

loans.use: to buy chemical fertilizers.

loans.name: Theresa

texts.en:
Theresa is 40 years old and lives in Compound #3. She is married and has five children between the ages of 19 and 25; three of them attend school and all of them live at home. Theresa did not go to school.

For the past 20 years, Theresa has been selling tables. She started this business with money that she borrowed from her mother. Theresa faces the problem of fewer goods. She is requesting a loan to purchase fresh fish for her business. Theresa likes her business because it helps her to save. Her plan is to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase fresh fish for her business

loans.name: Ne'ma

texts.en:
Ne’ma is a 44-year-old married woman. Her husband is a freelance farmer.
Two years ago, Ne’ma started a small retail business at home selling clothes and home products. Recently, she has had an increase in the number of customers and orders that she gets, so she has applied for a loan to add more clothes with different designs for different ages.

loans.use: to add more clothes with different designs for different ages.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary, 39 years old, lives in Compound #3. She is married and has five children between 4 and 22 years old;, three are in school and all live at home. Mary's husband is a businessman.

For the past twelve years, Mary has been selling palm oil and pepper. She started this business with sell pay (the Liberian way of doing business: when you don’t have money, sell the goods, return the principal and keep the profit). Mary faces the problem of cash shortages. She is requesting a loan to purchase palm oil and pepper for her business. She learned this way of business from her mother and she likes it because it makes her serious and strong and is a fast way of getting money. Mary's plan is to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase palm oil and pepper for  her business

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George, 42 years old, is married to Ann. He has been in the carpentry business in Nakuru for the last 6 years and is making good profits.

George was introduced to KADET by one of his neighbors and this will be his first loan. He plans to use the loan amount to buy more raw materials, such as timber, nails and glue, for use in his business. This will enable him to make more furniture, to increase his income and to provide for his family. In the future, George hopes to expand his carpentry business, open more carpentry shops in the area and employ more workers.

loans.use: To buy more raw materials for his carpentry business

loans.name: Fatmeh

texts.en:
Fatmeh is a 56-year-old married woman. Her husband is a farmer.
Long ago, Fatmeh started a tailoring business. She opened a small workshop and bought fabric for tailoring. She also does sewing.
Now, Fatmeh wants to improve more and try to serve her customers faster, so she has applied for a loan to buy a new sewing machine.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice, 37 years old, is married to Peter who also works to support the family. They have three children. Beatrice has been running a green grocery and selling clothes for a period of about five years with a monthly income of about 10,000 KES.

This is Beatrice’s third loan with KADET after successfully repaying her two previous ones. She wants to use this 60,000 KES loan to buy more new clothes to sell. She hopes to expand her business and give her children a quality education.

loans.use: To buy more new clothes to sell.

loans.name: John

texts.en: John is 62 years old. He is married to Esther and they have three children. John has been a dairy farmer for the past four years. He was brought to KADET LTD by a  staff member. This will be his first loan term in KADET LTD, and he plans to use it to pay school fees for his son. John hopes to see all of his children continue their education to the highest levels.

loans.use: to pay school fees for his  son.

loans.name: Jeannie

texts.en:
Jeannie, 29 years old, lives in Compound #3. She is married and her husband is a driver. They have seven children aged between 1 and 16 years old. Four of the children are in school and all of them live at home. 

For the past 17 years, Jeannie has been selling palm oil and dried meat. She is requesting a loan to purchase palm oil and dried meat for her business. Jeannie likes her business because it helps her to feed her children and send them to school. Her plan is to build a house for her children.

loans.use: to purchase palm oil and dried meat for her business

loans.name: Manal

texts.en:
Manal is a married woman who has three children.
Recently, Manal started a small business selling blankets and making embroidered dresses. 
She has applied for a loan in order to buy a new embroidery machine to make her job faster and easier.

loans.use: to buy a new embroidery machine

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy products for making food, and sets of cooking pots to sell.

loans.name: Pilar

texts.es:
Pilar, de 36 años de edad, es una mujer trabajadora y empeñosa, además de ser amable y cordial. Es conviviente con Miguel quien es independiente y padre de sus 5 hijos, Wendy,  Deybi, Jennifer, Silvia y Maycol; de 18, 15, 10, 6 y 3 años de edad respectivamente. Juntos habitan cómodamente su propia casa.
La actividad que realiza Pilar es el alquiler de bicicletas de  su propiedad, tiene 3 unidades que están operativas. También cuenta con un mototaxi que lo alquila a su vecino.  Para eso tiene un espacio acondicionado en su casa donde guarda sus bicicletas y les brinda el mantenimiento del cual se encarga su pareja. Se inició hace más de 6 años con una bicicleta y viendo la demanda de sus servicio, decidió invertir adquiriendo más unidades, y en transcurso sufriendo el robo de una unidad  llego a tener 9 unidades, ahora con el deterioro solo están operativas 3, y las otras 6 están en mantenimiento, y hasta el momento cuenta con el apoyo de sus pareja y sus hijos en la atención.
Considera a su negocio rentable por los ingresos que le deja ya que tiene demanda su servicio
Antes de empezar su negocio tenía dificultades económicas ya que los ingresos de su pareja no les alcanzaban para cubrir los gastos de su hogar, ahora puede apoyarlo y aspira a tener una mejor calidad de vida.
Con las ganancias que tiene de su trabajo espera ahorrar para comprar otra unidad de mototaxi y alquilarlo para aumentar sus ingresos. Este será el préstamo número 3 con la institución MFP, se siente agradecida de contar con un apoyo financiero para avanzar con su negocio. Además comenta estar a gusto con su banco comunal, pues conoce a sus integrantes y los considera ser personas amables y responsables.
Con el monto solicitado de 1200 nuevos soles, lo invertirá como parte de pago de otra unidad de mototaxi valorizado en 5000 nuevos soles, para así ampliar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Pilar is 36 years old and in addition to being hardworking, she is also a friendly and cordial woman. She lives with Miguel, who is independent and is the father of her five children: Wendy (18), Deybi (15), Jennifer (10), Silvia (6) and Maycol (3). They live together comfortably in a house that they own.

Pilar has a bike rental business, and rents out three bicycles she owns and which are in working condition. She also has a mototaxi which she rents to her neighbor. She has a space set aside in her home where she stores her bicycles and where Miguel provides maintenance to them. She started her business over six years ago with one bicycle. After noticing a demand for her services, she decided to invest in the purchase of additional bikes. One bicycle was stolen along the way, but she was able to obtain nine bicycles. Through wear-and-tear, only three bikes are currently in working condition and the remaining six are being repaired. Pilar’s partner and children help her to tend to the business.

She considers her business to be profitable due to the earnings she receives, as there is a demand for her services. Prior to starting her business, she had financial troubles because her partner’s income was not sufficient to cover the household expenses. However, she can now help him and she hopes to have a better quality of life.

With her earnings, she hopes to save in order to buy another mototaxi and rent it out to increase her income. This will be her third loan with MFP and she is grateful for the financial support to help her business grow. In addition, she says that she likes her communal bank, as she has come to know her fellow members and considers them to be friendly and responsible. She will invest the 1,200 PEN (Peruvian Nuevos Soles) requested toward the purchase of a 5,000 PEN mototaxi in order to increase her income.

loans.use: to purchase another mototaxi.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is a 36-year-old single mother of four children aged sixteen, eleven, seven and four years old. She has been farming for the past year and earns a monthly income of 9,000 KES.

Jane has requested a loan of 10,000 KES, her first, from KADET to purchase chemicals (C.A.N.) and a knapsack and sprayer to spray her crops so that they are not infected by disease this planting season. The profits earned from her business will help her pay school fees and buy another cow, as she is also a dairy farmer on the side.

Jane’s dream is to open a clothes boutique as well as lift her family's standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase chemicals, a knapsack and a sprayer for her fields.

loans.name: Maria Del Carmen

texts.es: La señora María, es habitante del municipio de Nindiri, ella es madre soltera, tiene a su cargo dos hijos pequeños de 6 y 3 añitos,  desde hace cinco años se dedica a distribuir productos de herbalife ya que es su mayor  ingreso económico para mantener a sus pequeños , ella necesita un préstamo para terminar de construir un pequeño cuarto para sus bebes ; ya que donde habita es un solo cajón y no puede gozar de privacidad ya que cuando hay visitas todo está en un mismo sitio como es la cama , la cocina , entre otras cosas.
texts.en: María lives in the municipality of Nindiri. She is a single mother. She has her two small children, 6 and 3 years old, in her charge. For five years she has been selling Herbalife products, and this is her main income for supporting her children. She needs a loan to finish building a small room for her children. Where she lives is just one big room, and she doesn't have any privacy because when people come to visit, everything is in the room, such as her bed, the kitchen, and other things.

loans.use: to buy construction materials.

loans.name: Haya

texts.en:
Haya is 55 years old and is widowed. She lives now with her son, Rakan, a 32-year-old man, in a rented house.
To be able to support herself and participate in the rent payment, Haya started a small business selling blankets in winter. In other seasons, she sells other products depending on what she has.
Now, Haya has applied for a loan to buy accessories and more blankets to sell until the end of this season.

loans.use: to buy accessories and more blankets

loans.name: Mayda Lizeth

texts.es:
Mayda tiene 21 años de edad, es casada hace tres años su esposo trabaja en un supermercado y tiene un hijo de 1 año de edad, vive con ellos en la Colonia Puente alto de Puerto Cortes.
Mayda es una joven muy emprendedora. Por lo que hace 3 años estableció un negocio  de venta de mercadería en general. Ayudada por su esposo quien le proporciono el capital para poder trabajar. Ella ofrece venta de cremas para el cuerpo y cabello, perfumes de mujer y ropa de segunda mano para caballeros, damas y niños. Su mercadería la vende de manera ambulante en las comunidades vecinas. Considera que la inversión hecha le ha ayudado mucho ya que cuenta con su propio negocio y genera sus propios ingresos. Trabaja desde las 6.00 am hasta las 4.00 pm.
Solicita su segundo préstamo de 10,000 lempiras, el cual le  ayudara a invertir en comprar  Ropa de segunda mano, perfumes y crema, para aumentar su inventario y ofrecer a sus clientes mejor servicio.
Su meta es ser una comerciante individual constituida, para tener la solvencia económica para surtir de  mercadería que no ha podido comprar.
texts.en:
Mayda is 21 years old.  She has been married for the last three years, and her husband works in a supermarket.  They have a one-year-old child.  Mayda lives with them in the Puente Alto development in Puerto Cortes.

Mayda is a very enterprising young woman, who set up a business selling general merchandise three years ago.  She was helped in this by her husband, who provided her with the capital to be able to work.  She sells body lotions and hair lotions, women's perfumes, and second-hand clothing for men, women and children.  She sells her merchandise as a street-vendor in the nearby communities.  She thinks that the investment that was made in her has greatly helped, as she now has her own business and earns her own income.  She works from 6 a.m. through to 4 p.m.

She is requesting a second loan of 10,000 lempiras, which will help her to invest in purchasing second-hand clothing, perfumes, and lotions.  This will increase her inventory and provide her customers with better service.

Her goal is to become established as an individual retailer, so that she can have financial solvency to stock up with merchandise that she hasn't been able to purchase so far.

loans.use: to purchase clothing, perfumes and lotions to stock up her business.

loans.name: Fama

texts.fr: Madame Fama est une femme mariée de 44 ans. Elle est mère de  6 enfants dont l’âge  varie entre  un et 19 ans. Elle évolue dans le secteur du commerce depuis plus de 15 ans. Elle pratique la vente de jus, glace et divers autres aliments. Elle a choisi cette activité  de commerce par passion, et est surtout intéressée par  son aspect lucratif. Elle est membre du guichet de l’U-IMCEC de sa zone d’habitation depuis mai 2011. Elle sollicite un crédit de 300 000 frs prévu pour le démarrage d’une nouvelle activité a savoir l’ouverture d’un restaurant  au niveau d’un garage  de taxis. L’objet de son crédit est l’aménagement de ce dernier  dans le but de pouvoir  vendre à  ceux qui fréquentent ce lieu et ses environs des plats  aux heures de repas. Elle souhaite accroitre ses  bénéfices et améliorer  la situation sociale de sa famille.
texts.en:
Ms. Fama is a 44-year-old married woman. She is the mother of six children, from 1 to 19 years old. She has been working in the commercial sector for over fifteen years selling juices, ice, and a variety of foods. She chose this business out of passion and is particularly interested by the lucrative aspect of it.

Ms. Fama has been a member of the U-IMCEC granch office in the area where she lives since May 2011. She is requesting a loan of 300,000 francs for fixing up a new business, namely opening a restaurant in a taxi depot. The goal of her loan is to renovate it with the goal of selling dishes at mealtime to those who come around this depot.

Ms. Fama would like to  increase her profits and to improve her family's social situation.

loans.use: to renovate a restaurant

loans.name: Gloria

texts.es:
Gloria, de 49 años de edad, es una mujer trabajadora y empeñosa, además de ser amable y alegre. Está casada con Nando quien es independiente y padres de sus hijos quienes ya son mayores e independientes. Juntos viven en su propia casa en compañía de uno de sus hijos, Ricardo  de 24 años de edad. La actividad que realiza Gloria es la venta de ceviches que es un plato típico de la comida peruana, para lo cual cuenta con un local ambientado en su casa, ahorrándose gastos de alquiler. 
Cuenta que se inició con la llegada de su hija de la capital hace más de 3 años quien tuvo la idea de iniciarse en ese negocio, entonces se asociaron, empezando a vender solo los sábados y domingos, ofreciendo a los vecinos y de casa en casa  buscando conseguir clientes, luego fueron implementando un espacio en su casa con mesas y sillas para atender cómodamente a su nuevos clientes, ahora han ampliado los días de venta y cuenta con el apoyo de 2 ayudantes para la atención, a quienes paga por semana y la preparación de encarga su hija. Considera su negocio bastante rentable por  las buenas guanacias que le deja y la regular clientela que ha sabido ganarse.
Por otro lado, comenta que se inició debido a la necesidad de contar con un ingreso adicional y apoyar a su hija con la realización del negocio, viendo que es una buena idea se aventuraron obteniendo buenos resultados gracias a sus esfuerzos.
Ahora, tiene deseos  de ampliar su negocio con más mesas y sillas para la comodidad de sus clientes. Este será e el préstamo número 3 con la institución MFP. Está agradecida al saber que contará con una línea de crédito para concretar sus planes. Por otro lado, dice estar a gusto con su banco comunal pues lo considera un grupo unido y responsable.
Con el monto solicitado de 1000 nuevos soles lo invertirá  en la compra de utensilios de cocina como platos, vasos, también de inmobiliarios como mesas y sillas, y con el saldo ingresantes para la preparación del ceviche.
texts.en:
Gloria, aged 49, is an enterprising and earnest woman, who is also friendly and happy.  She is married to Nando, who works for himself, and they are the parents of children who are now grown-up and financially independent.  They live in their own home together with one of their sons, Ricardo, who is 24 years old.

The work that Gloria does is selling ceviche, which is a traditional dish in Peruvian cuisine.  She sells from premises that are located in her home, which saves her paying rent.  She tells that she began this business when her daughter came into some capital over three years ago.  Her daughter had the idea to begin this business, so they partnered together and began selling only on the weekends.  They sold to neighbors and also went door-to-door looking to find customers.  Later on, they set up a space in their home with tables and chairs to serve their new customers comfortably.  They have now increased the days on which they sell, and have two people helping with serving whom they pay weekly.  Her daughter is in charge of preparing the ceviche.  Gloria considers her business to be quite profitable, as it provides good earnings and they have been able to gain a regular clientele.  She comments that she began this work due to the necessity of having additional income, and to support her daughter in making the business a reality.  She saw that is was a good idea for them to venture into this, earning good results thanks to their efforts.

She now wants to expand her business with more tables and chairs for the comfort of her customers.  This will be her third loan with the MFP lending institution.  She is grateful to know that she can count on a line of credit to make her plans reality.  On the other hand, she says that she enjoys being part of her communal bank, as she considers them to be a united and responsible group.

With the requested sum of 1,000 new soles, she will invest in the purchase of cooking utensils such as plates and glasses, and also in furniture such as tables and chairs.  The balance will go towards preparing ceviche.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients to prepare more food, and also buy cooking utensils, tables and chairs.

loans.name: Heyam

texts.en:
Heyam is a 37-year-old woman. She is a mother with two sons and two daughters. Her husband is a schoolteacher who gets a low salary that is not enough to cover the family's needs.

For the past three years, Heyam has been raising and selling sheep and sheep products, which has been a profitable project and helps to support her family's income.

Heyam is requesting a $3,000 USD loan from FATEN to help her cover the costs of purchasing fodder to feed the sheep. This will increase sales and improve the family's income positively.

Heyam is photographed in the picture.

loans.use: To purchase fodder to feed the sheep.

loans.name: Bandu

texts.en:
Bandu lives in Compound #3. She is 23 years old and she did not go school. She is married and has two children, age 5 and 11, who are in school and live at home.

For the past six years, she been operating a salon. She started this business with the help of her friend. She is requesting a loan to purchase artificial hair  for her business. She plans to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase artificial hair for her business.

loans.name: Rebbeca

texts.en:
Rebbeca has been in the properties business for the last 17 years. She is 54 years old and a single mother of three children.

She was introduced to KADET by one of the existing clients, and this will be her first loan. She plans to use the loan amount to boost her capital for buying retail merchandise and properties, then selling it at a profit.

In the future, Rebbeca hopes to own a real estate business to establish residential and commercial houses and become one of the leading businesswomen in Nakuru.

loans.use: To boost capital for buying retail merchandise and properties.

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George is 30 years old. He is married to Vivian, and, together, they have one child. He operates a mobile-phone repair shop. He has been in the business for the past five years.

He was brought to KADET LTD by a KADET client. This will be his first loan with KADET LTD. He will use the loan amount to purchase phone accessories to boost his business.

He hopes to own a mobile-phone shop to sell phones in the future.

loans.use: to buy  phone accessories to boost his business.

loans.name: Liset

texts.es:
Giulliana, de 28 años de edad, es una joven mujer trabajadora y decidida, además de ser alegre y cordial. Es madre soltera y tiene 4 hijos de 12, 5, 3 años de edad y 2 meses de nacido. Juntos viven en la casa de sus padres en compañía de su papá y mamá, quienes la apoyan con el cuidado de sus hijos. El negocio que tiene Giulliana es la venta de comidas como juanes, pollos asados, anticuchos y otros. Todos las tardes instala su mesa en el frontis de la casa de sus padres y ofertas todos sus comidas preparadas, además de refrescos, atendiendo muy amablemente a sus clientes quienes son en su mayoría sus propios vecinos, y la recomiendan a otros personas que con el tiempo se vuelven sus clientes habituales.
Se inició hace más de 5 años con un préstamo particular, comprando y vendiendo en pocas cantidades, para luego ir aumentando de acuerdo a la demanda de sus comidas, y hasta el momento lo realiza ella sola.
Considera a su negocio bastante rentable por las ganancias que le deja, y que casi siempre acaba todo lo que prepara para vender.
Además comenta le gusta su negocio pues conoce de cocina y se decidió a empezar por la necesidad de contar con un ingreso propio y tener un oficio pues la pensión para sus hijos no les alcanzaba y tenía apuros económicos.
Ahora viendo los buenos resultados dese ampliarse y abrir una bodega de venta de abarrotes en la casa de sus padres. Este será el préstamo número 3 con la institución MFP. Está contenta de saber que seguirá teniendo acceso a una línea de crédito para continuar con sus planes. Además comenta estar a gusto con su banco comunal, pues conoce a sus integrantes y los considera sus amigos y son responsables.
Con el monto solicitado de 1000 nuevo soles, lo invertirá en la compra de abarrotes en general buscando precios cómodos por sus compras, así empezar con éste nuevo negocio y aumentar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Giulliana, aged 28, is a hard-working and focused young woman, who is also happy and friendly.  She is a single mother, and has four children aged 12, 5, 3, and two months old.  They live in her parents' home, together with her dad an mom, who help her look after her children.

Giulliana's business is selling food such as juanes (a traditional dish from the Peruvian jungle similar to a tamale), grilled chicken, snacks and other things.  Every afternoon she sets up her table in front of her parents' houses and offers all her prepared dishes for sale.  She also sells refreshments.  She serves her customers, most of whom are her neighbors, in a very friendly manner, and they recommend her to other people who over time become regular customers themselves.

She started this business over five years ago with a specific loan, purchasing and selling in small quantities so that she could later grow in line with demand for her dishes. Up until now, she has been doing all this on her own.

She considers her business to be quite profitable because of the earnings that it provides, and and because she almost always sells everything that she prepares.  She also tells us that she enjoys her business, as she knows how to cook.  She decided to begin the business out of the need to have her own income and have a trade, as she wasn't able to cover expenses for her children and she was having financial difficulties.

Seeing her good results, she now wants to expand and open a grocery store in her parents' home.  This will be her third loan with the MFP lending institution.  She is happy to know that she will be able to have access to a line of credit in order to continue with her plans.  She also comments that she enjoys being part of her communal bank, as she knows all the members, and considers them to be her friends and to be responsible people.

With the requested amount of 1,000 new soles, she will invest in purchasing general groceries.  She will be looking for low prices for her purchases, so that she can start up this new business and increase her income.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of products to stock up her grocery store.

loans.name: Yuth

texts.en:
Yuth, age 56, is widowed and resides with her son in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She has been producing stoves to sell for over six years, earning approximately USD 3.00 per day. Her son is employed in a garment factory and earns about USD 3.00 per day. 

Due to the difficulty in the family’s access to transportation, Yuth is requesting a loan of USD 600.00 to purchase a motorbike to use to commute to work. This purchase will enable her to use the money saved on her transportation expenses to support the family. 

In the future, she would like to expand her present business and rebuild her family house to make it stronger and to provide better living conditions for the family.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike to use to commute to work

loans.name: Bartolome

texts.es:
Bartolomé, de 35 años de edad, es un hombre con muchas ganas de trabajar y deseoso de brindar una mejor calidad de vida a su familia, por eso es dedicado al trabajo. Es conviviente con Mónica quien es ama de casa y madre de sus 2 hijos: Cristian y José de 11 y 6 años de edad respectivamente a quienes quiere mucho.  Juntos están instalados cómodamente en su propia casa que compraron con mucho esfuerzo. La actividad que realiza Bartolomé es la venta de pescado fresco que compra por las madrugadas en el puerto más cercano y lo lleva a su puesto de venta en el mercado, donde atiende muy bien a sus clientes entregándoles los mejores ejemplares y  frescos, sabiendo que de esa manera le seguirán comprando en el futuro.
Se inició hace más de 12 años, empezó trabajando como ayudante en los botes pesqueros en los puertos, luego con un capital propio se decidió a empezar con su propio negocio dedicándose a la venta de pescado y hasta el momento lo realiza solo. Considera a su negocio bastante rentable por las buenas ganancias que le deja y su habilidad con el negocio pues lo conoce muy bien. Antes de empezar con su negocio, sus ingresos como ayudante no le alcanzaba para los gastos de su hogar, viendo esta dificultad se decidió a cambiar.
Ahora ve que sigue teniendo buenos resultados y tiene planes de ampliar su negocio y realizar envíos a  otras ciudades de su producto en mayor cantidad, sabe que así tendrá mayores ganancias. Este será el préstamo número 4 con la institución MFP. Está contento de saber que tendrá el apoyo financiero necesario para continuar con sus planes. Además comenta que le gusta el trabajo de su banco comunal por el apoyo que vienen brindando  a las personas con sus negocios. Con el monto solicitado de 1500 nuevos soles los invertirá en la compra de su mercadería en mayor volumen para el envío a otras ciudades, buscando precios más cómodos por sus compras en cantidades grandes.
texts.en:
Bartolomé is a 35 year old man with a desire and energy to work and wants to offer the best quality of life to his family, so he is very dedicated to his work.  He lives with Monica who is a stay-at-home mother of two sons; Cristian and José, 11 and 6 respectively, who she loves very much.  Together they live comfortably in their own house that they bought after much effort.  Bartolomé's work is selling fresh fish that he buys in the early morning at the local port.  He then takes it to his stand at the market, where he takes care of his customers, offering them the best and most fresh fish, knowing that in this way they will continue to buy from him in the future.  

He began 12 years ago, working as an assistant on fishing boats in the port, then with his own capital he decided to start his own business selling fish.  Up until now, he has been carrying out his work alone.  He considers his business to be very profitable as a result of the good earnings that it gives him and he knows well his own abilities to run it.  Before beginning his business, he didn't earn enough as an assistant to pay for his household expenses, and seeing that difficulty he made the decision to change.  

Now he sees that he will to continue to have good results and he has plans to expand his business and to send his products to other cities in greater quantities, knowing that in that way he will earn a higher profit.  This will be his 4th loan with MFP.  He is happy to know that he will have the financial support necessary to continue with his plans.  He comments as well that he is pleased with the work of the community bank for the support that they are bringing to people's businesses.  With the requested loan of 1500 nuevos soles, he will invest in purchasing higher quantities of his products to send to other cities, looking for lower prices for his bulk purchases.

loans.use: to purchase a greater quantity and variety of fish.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more farm equipment and to buy potato and cabbage seedlings

loans.name: Wafaa

texts.en:
Wafaa, age 32, is a conservative person who prefers not to have her photo published online, so her husband appears in her Kiva profile photo. She and her husband have two sons and one daughter. Her husband is a construction worker who receives a low salary that is enough to cover the family's costs but not to complete finishing the family house.
 
Wafaa is requesting a 2,500 USD loan from FATEN to help her and the family cover the costs of finishing the construction of the family house, such as paying for installing tiles, installing windows and doors, and painting. 

Taking out this loan will help Wafaa to improve the family's living conditions by finishing its construction and moving the family into it soon.

loans.use: to pay for finishing construction of the family home

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a 36-year-old business lady. She is a single mother of one child aged 20 years. She has been selling shoes for the past seven year with the monthly income of KES 8,000 which she uses to support her family.

She is applying for his first loan term with KADET LTD after being introduced by a KADET staff member. Mary will use the loan to buy new shoes for sale.

She will use the anticipated profit from the business to educate her child. Her hopes and dreams are to open a boutique shop.

loans.use: to buy new shoes for sale

loans.name: Victor

texts.es:
Víctor de 52 años está casado con Furora. Ambos tienen un hijo de 30 años, pero ya vive independientemente. Víctor y Furora viven juntos en una casa propia ubicada en la comunidad nativa Inchatingari, distrito de Perené, provincia de Chanchamayo.
Desde que era un niño, Víctor se desenvolvía con facilidad en el trabajo del campo. Ahora, a su avanzada edad, cuenta con 5 parcelas de terrenos propios donde produce café, naranjas, plátanos, achiote y yucas. Pero da prioridad al café y achiote ya que los otros le sirven de alimentos, casi siempre.
“Tengo 4 chacras de café, el año pasado coseché 20 sacos y este año será igual”, menciona. Víctor vende cada saco de 70 kilos a 120 soles, por eso, cada año se esmera en el cuidado de las plantas, para que las enfermedades más comunes como: la “arañera” y el “ojo de gallo”, no malogren las hojas y granos del café.
Así también, la siembra de achiote es rentable, porque la demanda del producto se da en todo el año. Los compradores llevan estos frutos para la elaboración de condimentos y tintes naturales.
Víctor y Furora viven en armonía trabajando juntos en el campo. No tienen muchas preocupaciones pero si quieren continuar con su trabajo porque les gusta vivir rodeados de plantas y aire puro.
Éste sería su crédito número 3 que él obtendría de MFP, gracias a su apoyo, por eso da su palabra de ser puntual en el pago de las cuotas mensuales. Se siente satisfecho trabajando con su banco comunal “Los productores de Inchatingari”, por la solidaridad y por los intereses en común de sus integrantes.
De recibir el dinero, podrá pagar a los jornaleros que contratará para el “macheteo” (limpieza de sus cultivos). Con lo restante comprará bolsas de fertilizantes.
texts.en:
Victor is 52 years old and is married to Furora.  Together they have a son who is 30 years old, but he now lives independently.  Victor and Furora live together in their own house located in the native community of Inchatingari, in the Perene district, in the province of Chanchamayo.
Since he was a child, Victor has carried out farm work with ease.  Now, at his advanced age, he owns 5 plots of land where he produces coffee, oranges, plantains, annatto seed and yucca.  However, he gives priority to coffee and annatto seed since he almost always uses the other crops as a food source.
"I have 4 coffee farms.  Last year I harvested 20 bags and this year it will be the same", he says.  Victor sells each 70-kilo bag for 120 soles.  Because of this, each year he takes great pains to care for his plants, so that common plant diseases such as coffee-leaf rot and rooster's eye do not ruin the leaves and coffee beans.
Sowing annatto seed is also profitable, because the demand for this product exists year-round.  Buyers use this fruit for the production of condiments and natural dyes.
Victor and Furora live in harmony working together in the fields.  They have few worries, but they want to continue working because they like to live surrounded by plants and fresh air.
This will be this 3rd loan at the MFP, thanks to their support.  For this, he gives his word that he will be punctual in making his monthly payments.  He feels satisfied working with the communal bank "Los productores de Inchatingari", because of the solidarity and the common interests of its members.
With this loan, he will be able to pay day workers that he will hire to to harvest the crops.  With the rest he will buy bags of fertilizer.

loans.use: to hire day workers and buy bags of fertilizer.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is 54 years of age and a widowed mother of 2 children. She lives in Nakuru town and has operated her banana selling business for the last 20 years.

She was introduced to KADET by one of the field officers and this will be her 1st loan. She plans to use the loan amount to buy more stock of bananas for sale and thereby increase her income. She usually supplies the bananas to various traders and markets in Nakuru town. Therefore this loan will enable her to meet the high demand for this commodity.

In the future, Jane hopes to expand her business and even supply the bananas to other markets out of Nakuru town and make more profits thus improving her family's living standards.

loans.use: To add more stock of bananas

loans.name: Magnolia

texts.es:
Magnolia, de 43 años de edad, es una mujer trabajadora y empeñosa con muchas ganas de salir adelante, además de ser amable y cordial en su trato. Es conviviente con Luís quien es comerciante y padre de sus 5 hijos Irina de 22, Jilda de 19, Lisenia de 17, Helen de 13 y Katerin de 10 años de edad. Juntos viven en su propia casa que logró comprar con la colaboración de su pareja. La actividad que tiene Magnolia es la venta de ropa de segundo uso que compra en los centros comerciales de la ciudad, para luego venderlo en los caseríos apostados a las riveras de los ríos en sus viajes, logrando que los moradores le compren a quienes atiende de manera amable y cordial  logrando ganarse sus preferencias.
Se inició hace más de 7 años con un capital propio fruto de sus ahorros con su pareja, y hasta el momento lo viene realizando ella sola.
Considera a su negocio bastante rentable ya que por esas zonas logran vender a precios más elevados, teniendo márgenes de ganancia mas elevados.
Antes de empezar con su negocio tenia problemas económicos ya que los ingresos de su pareja no les alcanzaba y su familia crecía, además que los precios de los alimentos también aumentaban, entonces decidió generarse sus propios ingresos para apoyar a en la economía de su hogar.
Ahora con las ganancias que le deja sea invertir en una bodega de abarrotes en su casa, para así estar más tiempo cerca de sus hijos. Este será el préstamo número 4 con la institución MFP. Por tanto espera de un pequeño préstamo para que pueda cumplir con sus objetivos. Además esta contenta con el grupo de su banco comunal por el trabajo que vienen realizando con el apoyo a las personas con sus negocios.
Con el monto solicitado de 1500 nuevos soles, lo invertirá en la compra de ropa de segundo uso, para así aumentar el stock de sus mercaderías, buscando precios cómodos por sus compras en volumen.
texts.en:
Magnolia, who is 43 years old, is a hard-working and determined woman with a great will to advance, in addition to being kind and cordial in her business dealings. She lives with Luis, who is a merchant and is the father of their five children, Irina, who is 22, Jilda, 19, Lisenia, 17, Helen, 13, and Katerin, 10. They live together in their own house, which she managed to buy with the help of her partner. Magnolia's business is selling secondhand clothing, which she buys in the commercial centers of the city to then sell by traveling to the little villages located on the banks of the rivers. The residents there buy from those who serve them in a friendly and cordial manner, who thus succeed in winning their business. She began this business more than 7 years ago with some of her own capital, the fruit of her and her partner's savings, and so far she has been working alone. She considers her business fairly profitable, since in these areas she manages to sell at higher prices and has higher profit margins.

Before she began her business, she had financial problems, since her partner's income was not sufficient and her family was growing. Furthermore, the prices of food were also increasing. Then she decided to generate her own income to help with the household finances. Now she would like to invest her earnings in a grocery store in her house, so that she can spend more time near her children. This will be her fourth loan with MFP.  Thus she hopes for a little loan so that she can complete her goals. In addition, she is happy with the group in her communal bank because of the work that they are doing, providing help to people and their businesses. With the 1500 PEN that she has applied for, she will invest in the purchase of secondhand clothing, to thus increase her stock of merchandise, looking for affordable prices by making her purchases in volume.

loans.use: to buy more secondhand clothing to sell.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth is 42 years old and married to Isaiah. They have been blessed with 5 children. She has been in the shoe selling business in Nakuru town for the last 6 years.

She was introduced to KADET by one of her friends and this will be her first loan. She plans to use the loan amount to buy more stock of shoes for resale in her business.

In the future, Ruth hopes to own a big shoe selling shop and make more income and improve the living standards for her family.

loans.use: To add more stock of shoes

loans.name: Duo Nohemi Group

texts.es:
Duo Nohemi 
Está integrada por las señoras Rosa Felipa, de 26 años de edad casada, y madre de Estefany de 4 años de edad, doña Rosa desde hace 5 años se ha dedicado a la venta de consumo diario en un pequeño local que junto a su esposo lograron ubicar en su casa, ahora cuenta con una pequeña venta de útiles  escolares, ella ha visto que los niños llegan y necesitan de otros artículos que ella no tiene por lo que ella desea invertir un poco más en productos de libreria como crayones, marcadores, papelería,  temperas etc. También doña Gregoria quien desde ya varios años se ha dedicado a cualquier venta que pueda para lograr apoyar a su esposo en manutención de sus 4 hijos, ella se dedica a la venta de servilletas y artículos de limpieza, cosméticos, perfumes por catalogo  con lo que ella logra ganar de sus ventas ayuda a su hija mayor quien cursa el segundo grado de educación básica.  Ambas necesitan seguir trabajando pero requieren de capital para seguir brindándoles a sus clientes lo que necesitan.
texts.en: "Duo Nohemi" consists of Rosa Felipa, a 26-year-old married mother of a 4-year-old daughter, Estefany. Rosa has made a living for the past five years selling groceries out of a tiny storefront that she and her husband run out of their home. Currently she sells a small number of school supplies, and she has seen kids come looking for other items that she doesn't have. For that reason, she wants to invest more in these kinds of products like crayons, markers, stationery, and other items. The other member of the group is Gregoria, who for a number of years has made a living selling all kinds of things to support her husband and their four children. She currently sells napkins, cleaning supplies, cosmetics and perfumes via catalog, and what she earns helps her eldest daughter, who is attending second grade. Both women need to keep working but require capital to continue providing customers what they want.

loans.use: to purchase supplies like crayons, markers, stationery, etc.

location.town: Aldea Cruz Blanca San Juan Sacatepequez

loans.name: Moses

texts.en:
Moses is 23 years of age and single. He has operated his clothing sales business in Nakuru town for the last three years.

He was introduced to KADET LTD by one of the field officers and this will be his first loan. He plans to use the loan amount to buy more stock of T-shirts for sale. This will enable him to run and manage his business well and also satisfy his customers needs.

In the future, Moses hopes to own a permanent shop and stock it up with new and different clothes hence make more income and even build his own house and improve his living standards.

loans.use: To add more stock of T-shirts for sale.

loans.name: Khaled

texts.en:
Khaled is a 28-year-old single guy. He is the oldest among nine siblings. 
Khaled was able to open a small, humble cafeteria to make a few types of sandwiches. He now wants to buy new equipment and goods in order to add more kinds of sandwiches and snacks, and he hopes that he can also add a new pastry section in the cafeteria. For that, he has applied for this loan.

loans.use: to add more kinds of sandwiches and snacks

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
Lucia is 38 years old and a single mother of three school going children. She has operated her business in Nakuru town for the last three years.

She was introduced to KADET LTD by one of our field officers and this will be her first loan. She plans to use the loan amount to buy more stock of fruits and assorted vegetables for sale.

In the future, Lucia hopes to grow her business and open her own retail shop and thereby get more income and be able to provide the best education for her children.

loans.use: to buy more stock of fruits and assorted vegetables for sale.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is 56 years of age, married to Richard who is a plumber and they are blessed with two children. She has been in the shoe selling business in Nakuru town for the last seven years.

She was introduced to KADET by one of our field officers and this will be her first loan. She plans to use the loan amount to buy more stock of shoes for sale in her business.

In the future, Margaret hopes to own a shoe store and sell all kinds of shoes for men, women and children and thereby make more income.

loans.use: To buy more stock of shoes

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles has operated in the motorcycle transport industry in Naivasha town for the last 3 years. He is 38 years old, married to Rose and they have two children. 

He was introduced to KADET by his friend and this will be his first loan. He plans to use the loan amount to buy a new motorcycle so as to expand this business. 

In the future, Charles hopes to buy a pickup truck which he will be using to transport goods to and from the market.

loans.use: To buy another motorbike

loans.name: Susana

texts.es:
Susana, de 33 años de edad, es una mujer con mucha ganas de salir adelante y brindarse una mejor calidad de vida. Es conviviente con Pablo quien es comerciante. Juntos viven en una casa alquilada en compañía de una sobrina y su hermana. La actividad que tiene Susana es la venta de lubricantes de motos par eso cuenta con una tienda en un local alquilado. Todas sus mercaderías las trae desde la capital y las vende a precios competitivos logrando ganarse la preferencia de sus clientes quienes la recomiendan  con otras personas, logrando hacer crecer su clientela siendo su tienda muy concurrida.
Se inició hace más de 2 años por idea de su pareja y contando con un capital propio, contando con el apoyo de su pareja en la atención en sus tiempos libres.
Considera a su negocio bastante rentable por la demanda que tienen sus productos por los precios justos que oferta, además de haber un parque vehicular que va en aumento.
Antes de iniciar su negocio no contaba con ingresos propios, por eso decidió contar con un oficio y genéraselos, de esa manera también apoyaría a su pareja en realizar sus planes de comprar su propia casa.
Por tanto viendo los buenos resultados, desea en un futuro aumentar la cantidad de su mercadería y ampliar con la venta de repuestos de motos. Este será el préstamo número 12 con la institución MFP. Por ello espera de su colaboración para que pueda concretar sus planes. Por otro lado se compromete una vez más de cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas, como en anteriores crédito que tuvo. Además le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas que son responsables y muy solidarias
Con  el monto solicitado de 1000 nuevos soles lo invertirá en la compra de lubricantes al por mayor así tendrá un stock disponible para la venta. Desea conseguir  precios más cómodos por sus compras en volumen y contar con mayores ganancias.
texts.en: Susana is 33 years old and has a strong desire to make headway and improve her quality of life. She is married to Pablo, who is a merchant. They live together in a rented home along with her sister and niece. Susana makes a living selling motor oil out of a rented storefront. She brings in all of her merchandise from the capital and sells it at competitive prices to win the favor of her customers, who recommend her to other people to help grow her customer base. She has a well-visited store. She started more than two years ago on her husband's suggestion and with her own capital, and she relies on her husband's help when he has free time. She considers the business to be rather lucrative due to the demand for the products and the prices at which she offers them. Furthermore, the local vehicle fleet is increase. Before starting this business she didn't have her own income, so she decided to start a trade and earn a living, and in this way she could help her husband with their plans to buy their own home. She has seen good results, and she hopes in the future to increase her supply of merchandise and expand to selling spare parts. This will be her 12th loan with Kiva partner MFP, and she awaits your collaboration so she can put her plans into action. She promises once again to make her payments on time, as she has with her previous loans. She also enjoys being part of her community bank because all the members are responsible and stick together. With the loan, she plans to purchase wholesale motor oil so she will have an available stock to sell. She wants to lower her price base by buying in bulk, thus increasing her profits.

loans.use: to purchase wholesale motor oil.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is 48 years old and a father of three children. He has been in the tailoring business in Nakuru town for the last 11 years.

He was introduced to KADET LTD by one of our field officers and this will be his first loan. He plans to use the loan amount to buy another sewing machine for use in his business and also enable him to meet the rise in demand from his clients. He also plans to employ another tailor to assist him in the making and sewing of the clothes designs.

In the future, John hopes to own a big boutique shop to be displaying and selling his clothes designs for both men and women as well as children. He also hopes to own a laundry.

loans.use: To buy another sewing machine

loans.name: Garman

texts.en:
Garman lives in the Airport community. She is 25 years old, single and has two children, who 7 and 9 years old. The children are in school and live at home. For the past 10 years, she been selling rice and oil. A problem she faces is the rainy season. 

She is requesting a loan to purchase oil and rice for her business. She likes the way people respond to her business. Her plan is to become an international businesswoman and build a house.

loans.use: to purchase oil and rice for her business.

loans.name: Ibethsi

texts.es:
Ibethsi, de 29 años de edad, es una mujer trabajadora y empeñosa, además de ser amable y cordial en su trato a los demás. Es separada del padre de su hijo Fabricio de 3 años de edad. Vive en la casa de su padre en compañía de su hijo, su mamá y su papá, quienes la apoyan en la crianza de su hijo. La actividad que realiza Ibethsi es la venta de comidas como juanes, tallarines y otros por las mañanas. Para eso cuenta con un puesto en el mercado cerca a su casa donde atiende de manera amable y cordial a sus clientes ganándose su preferencia. 
Se inició hace más de 10 años con un capital propio y preparando en pequeñas cantidades, viendo la cogida que tenía su negocio, decidió continuar, y hasta el momento cuenta con el apoyo de su mamá en la preparación y atención de los clientes, compartiendo sus ganancias con ella.
Considera a su negocio bastante rentable porque casi siempre acaba todo lo que prepara para vender, dejándole buenas ganancias.
Decidió empezar con éste negocio debido a la necesidad de contar con un oficio y un ingreso económico para cubrir sus gastos y los de su hijo, ya que se separó de su pareja.
Viendo los buenos resultados que está tendiendo con su negocio tiene planes de continuar y hacerlo crecer. Este será el préstamo número 5 con la institución MFP, está contenta de saber que tendrá accesos un apoyo financiero para concretar sus planes. Además comenta estar a gusto con su banco comunal  pues conoce a la mayoría de sus  integrantes y los considera ser personas amables y responsables.
Con el monto solicitado de 2000 nuevos soles, los invertirá en la compra de utensilios para cocina como ollas, platos, vasos y otros, para renovar los qe tiene, así brindar una mejor atención a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Ibethsi, who is 29 years old, is a hard-working and determined woman, in addition to being friendly and cordial in her treatment of others. She is separated from the father of her son Fabricio, who is 3 years old. She lives in her father's house with her son, her mother, and her father, who help her to raise her son. Ibethsi's business is selling food such as juanes (a stuffed dish similar to a tamal, containing rice, spices, and meat, fish or yucca), noodles, and other items in the mornings. To do this she has a stall in the market near her home where she serves her customers in a friendly and cordial manner, winning their business.

She began more than 10 years ago, using her own capital and preparing in small quantities. Seeing the reception that her business had, she decided to continue, and so far she has had help from her mother in preparing the food and serving customers, and she shares her earnings with her. She feels that her business is fairly profitable because she almost always sells everything she prepares, giving her good earnings. She decided to begin this business because of the need to have a job and an income to cover her expenses and those of her son, since she is separated from her partner.

Seeing the good results she is having with her business, she has plans to continue it and make it grow. This will be her fifth loan with MFP. She is happy to know that she will have access to financial support to make her plans a reality. In addition, she comments that she feels comfortable with her community bank because she knows the majority of its members and considers them to be friendly and responsible people.

With the 2000 PEN that she has applied for, she will invest in the purchase of cooking utensils such as pots, plates, glasses, and other items to renew what she has and thus offer better service to her customers.

loans.use: to buy pots, plates, and glasses

loans.name: Vitalis

texts.en:
Vitalis is 46 years old and married to Naomi, who runs a retail shop. They live in Nakuru town and have five children. He has been in the motorcycle-transport business for the last 10 years.

He was introduced to KADET LTD by one of our existing clients, and this will be his first loan. He plans to use the loan amount to boost his wife's business; she wants to add more stock of goods for sale.

In the future, Vitalis hopes to grow his transport business and venture into other businesses as well.

loans.use: To support wife's retail business so she can add stock of goods for sale.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a 40-year-old business lady. She is married to Peter, a businessman. They are blessed with two children. She has been running a hotel (a small restaurant) for the past four years with the monthly income of 7,000 Kenyan shillings, which she uses to support her family.

She is applying for her first loan with KADET LTD, after being introduced by a KADET staff member. Mary will use the loan to buy stock of sugar, rice and cooking oil for sale. 

With the anticipated profit from the business, she will educate her children. Her hopes and dreams are to open a larger restaurant.

loans.use: to buy stock of sugar, rice and cooking oil.

loans.name: Sabina

texts.es:
Sabina, de 46 años de edad, es una mujer trabajadora y empeñosa con muchas ganas de progresar, además de ser alegre y social. Está casada con Oscar quien es jubilado y padre de sus hijos que en su mayoría ya son independientes. Juntos están cómodamente instalados en su propia casa en compañía de 2 de sus hijos Cristian de 30 años y Rosita de 16 años de edad, además de 2 nietos y su nuera. La actividad que realiza Sabina es la venta de ropa para damas caballeros y niños de variados modelos y a la moda, también vende sabanas y almohadas. Todos estos productos lo adquiere en la capital  realizando viajes periódicos y los vende entre sus vecinos y amistades a quienes atiende de manera muy amable y cordial, logrando ganarse sus preferencias y que la recomienden con otras personas,  aumentado sus clientes.
Se inició hace más 8 años con un préstamo de MFP, cuando integraba un grupo comunal y hasta el momento los viene realizando ella sola. Considera su negocio rentable por las buenas ganancias que le deja, además  de lograr vender todos sus productos.
Se decido a empezar con su negocio debido al deseo de contar con una ocupación y generarse sus propios ingresos, para sentirse una persona productiva.
Por tanto y viendo los buenos resultados que sigue teniendo desea continuar y mantener su negocio. Este será el préstamo número 4 con la institución MFP. Por tanto espera de un pequeño préstamo para que pueda cumplir con sus objetivos. Con el monto solicitado de 1000 nuevos soles los invertirá en la compra de su mercadería de ropas variadas en la capital, buscando precios más cómodos por sus compras en volumen, así aumentará sus márgenes de ganancias.
texts.en:
Sabina, 46, is a hardworking and industrious woman with strong ambitions to move forward in life and to be happy. She is married to Oscar, who is retired and the father of her children, most of whom are independent. They live comfortably together in their own home with two of their children - Cristian, 30, and Rosita, 16, as well as two of their grandchildren and their daughter-in-law.

Sabina works selling a variety of fashionable clothes for men, women and children, as well as sheets and cushions. She acquires all these items on regular trips to the capital, then sells them among her friends and neighbours. She serves her customers with a very friendly and amenable manner, which means they are loyal to her and recommend her to others, increasing her customer base.

Sabina started more than eight years ago with a loan from MFP, when she joined a communal group, and until now she has been working alone. She describes her business as profitable, as it provides her with good earnings, and she is able to sell all her products. She decided to start her business due to a desire to have an occupation and to generate her own income, so she could feel like a productive person. For that reason, and because of the good results she continues to have, she wants to carry on running her business.

This will be her fourth loan with MFP. She is hoping for a small loan in order to fulfill her goals. With the amount requested of 1,000 nuevos soles, she will invest in buying a variety of clothing while in the capital, and will be able to get better prices thanks to buying in bulk, thereby increasing her profit margins.

loans.use: To buy more clothes.

loans.name: Maria Francisca

texts.es: Maria Francisca, de 50 años de edad,ella se dedica a la venta y compra de café seco y venta de güipiles en el mercado municipal desde hace 21 años,ella nos cuenta que conforme los años han pasado ella a podido superarse poco a poco en su negocio,y no cuenta que ella nececita este credito para la compra de café seco y la compra de güipiles ya que se aserca la temporada en que sus clientes le hacen pedidos,esta muy agradecida con la institucion ya que se caracteriza por ayudar a las parsonas que mas lo nececitan desde ya agradece a kiva por el apoyo que le puedan brindar a travez del credito.
texts.en: Maria Francisca is 50 years old; she has bought and sold dry coffee as well as güipiles (traditional embroidered blouses) in the central market for 21 years. She tells us that she is happy with the years that have passed since she has been able to improve her life little by little because of her business. She needs the loan to buy dry coffee and güipiles since it is near the season when her customers ask for these items. Maria Francisca is thankful to the institutions since they are characterized for helping the people who need it most and is thanking Kiva now for the support that you can give her through the loan.

loans.use: buy dry coffee and güipiles to sell.

loans.name: Julia

texts.es:
Julia, de 62 años de edad, es una mujer trabajadora y empeñosa, además de ser alegre y cordial en su trato con las personas. Está casada con Máximo quien es comerciante y padre de sus hijos quienes ya son mayores e independientes. Juntos habitan cómodamente su propia casa. La actividad que realiza Julia es la venta de pescado fresco por las mañanas, su actividad empieza muy de temprano en la madrugada cuando se dirige al puerto a comprar su mercadería, luego se dirige a los asentamientos humanos y pueblos jóvenes a ofertar su producto de manera ambulatoria, atendiendo de manera amable a sus clientes quienes la esperan a diario para consumirle. También vende golosinas por las tardes desde su casa.
Se inició hace más de 8 años logrando hacerse muy conocida por las zonas que oferta sus productos y hasta el momento lo viene realizando sola.
Considera su negocio rentable porque casi siempre acaba todo lo que lleva para vender, dejándole buenas ganancias.
Antes de empezar con su negocio tenía dificultades económicas ya que los alimentos suben contantemente de precios y los ingresos de su esposo no les alcanzaba para cubrir todos sus gastos, por eso quiso apoyarlo generándose sus propios ingresos.
Por tanto, viendo lo bien que le resulta su negocio, desea continuar y mantenerlo. Este será el préstamo número 12 con la institución MFP. Por tanto espera de un pequeño préstamo para que pueda cumplir con sus objetivos. Por otro lado se compromete una vez más de cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas, como en anteriores crédito que tuvo. También comenta que se siente a gusto con banco comunal pues lo considera un grupo unido y solidario.
Con el monto solicitado de 1000 nuevos soles los invertirá en su negocio comprando pescados y golosinas, buscando aumentar su capital y conseguir precios cómodos por sus compras en volumen.
texts.en:
Julia is 62 years old, she is a hardworking and diligent woman, as well as, happy-go-lucky and is cordial to people. She is married to Máximo who is a salesman and father to Julia’s children who are adults and independent. They live comfortably in their own home. Julia sells fresh fish in the mornings; she gets up very early and goes to the harbor to buy her merchandize, and later goes to the stalls and towns to offer her products as a street vendor taking care of her customers who wait for her daily and buy her merchandize. Julia also sells candy during the afternoons in her home.

She began her business more than 8 years ago, making herself well-known throughout the area where she sells her products which at the moment she does by herself.

Julia considers her business to be profitable because she almost runs out of merchandize, leaving her with good earnings.

Before starting her business, Julia had some financial problems since food prices keep increasing and her husbands’ wages were not enough to meet all of their expenses. That is why she wanted to support her partner by generating some income of her own.

Seeing how well her business is doing Julia wishes to keep it. This will be her loan number 12 with MFP and hopes for a small loan to help her meet her goals. She is committed to meeting her loan quotas on time as she has done before. Julia says that she is happy with her communal bank since she considers them to be a united and supportive group.

With the 1000 nuevos soles, Julia will use the money to buy fish and candy to increase her stock and have better prices as she will buy in bulk.

loans.use: buy more variety of fish as well as candy.

loans.name: Bella

texts.es:
Bella, de 39 años de edad, es una mujer con muchas ganas de salir advente y apoyar a su familia. Es conviviente con Edwin quien es comerciante y padre de sus hijos por quienes se esfuerza por brindarles una mejor calidad de vida. Viven juntos en su propia casa que compraron con mucho esfuerzo. La actividad que realiza Bella es la venta de pescado fresco, empezando muy de temprano cuando se dirige al puerto a comprar su mercadería para venderlo en su puesto del mercado Bellavista, atendiendo muy amablemente a sus clientes, sabe que así se ganará sus preferencias y le seguirán comprando.
Se inicio hace mas de 8 años con un capital propio que invirtió comprando en pequeñas cantidades, luego  viendo la acogida que tiene su negocio fue aumentando sus ventas.
Considera a su negocio bastante rentable por las buenas ganancias que le deja y la demanda que tiene ese producto sobre todo en tiempo se escasez donde aumenta sus precios.
Se decidió a empezar con su negocio por la necesidad de apoyar a su pareja con los gastos del hogar y pagar los estudios de sus hijos.
Por tanto, ahora viendo los buenos resultados que tiene, desea mantener su negocio y continuarlo pues es su única fuente de ingresos. Este será el préstamo número 12 con la institución MFP. Por tanto espera de un pequeño préstamo para que pueda cumplir con sus objetivos. Por otro lado, comenta que le gusta el trabajo de su banco comunal por considerarlo un grupo unido y colaborador.
Con el monto solicitado de 1000 nuevos soles, los invertirá en la compra de su mercadería principal, que es el pescado fresco, buscando precios más cómodos por sus compras en volumen, para así obtener mayores ganancias.
texts.en:
Bella is 39 years old, she is a woman with a lot of drive to get ahead in life and support her family. She lives with Edwin who is a salesman and father to her children for whom he works hard to give a better quality of life. They live in their own home that they bought with a lot of hard work. Bella works selling fresh fish, she gets up very early in the morning and goes to the harbor to buy her merchandize and later sells her items in her stall in the Bellavista market where she takes care of her customers with kindness since she knows that she will gain their loyalty and will keep buying.

Bella started her business 8 years ago with her own capital and invested in buying merchandize in small quantities and when she saw the good response she increased her sales.

She considers her business to be profitable and the demand for her product good especially when it is scarce and she increases her prices.

Bella decided to start her business because she needed to help her partner with the household expenses and pay for her children’s education.

Seeing as she is getting good results, Bella wants to keep her business since it is her only source of income. This will be Bella’s loan number 12 with MFP and hopes for a small loan to meet her goals. She comments that she enjoys her work in the communal bank and considers it to be a united and supportive group.

With the 1000 nuevos soles, Bella will buy merchandize, mainly fresh fish, she will look for better prices as she will buy in bulk to have better income.

loans.use: buy a variety of fish.

loans.name: Alejandro
