texts.es: Don Alejandro,43 años de edad el se dedica a la compra y venta de granadias,aguacates,carbon, y leña.desde hace 15 años, el dice que esta actividad a sido de mucha bendicion para el porque es una forma de salir adelante,el sale a comprar su producto en todas las comunidades cercanas de donde vive y despues sale a venderlos a la capital,el ya es bien conocido por todas la las personas de las diferentes comunidades que el recorre a adiario, el solicita este credito para poder comprar un poco mas de frutas y la compra de leña,ya que nos cuenta que nececita mas capital para trabajar y esto tambien le serbira para agrandar mas su compra y venta de frutas y verduras.
texts.en:
Alejandro, 43, buys and sells pomegranates, avocados, charcoal and firewood and has been in business for 15 years.  He claims his work has been a huge blessing because it has allowed him to get ahead.  He buys his products in the communities near where he lives and then sells them in the capital city.  He is well known by everyone in the towns he visits daily.

He is requesting a loan to buy a little more fruit and firewood since he needs more capital to be able to work and expand his business.

loans.use: To buy pomegranates and avocados.

loans.name: Liz

texts.es: Liz, de 36 años es una mujer trabajadora y alegre, es madre de dos niños, el primero tiene 13 años y está en etapa escolar, mientras que la menor una linda y robusta bebe recién acaba de nacer hace 2 semanas y es un motivo mas para ella de trabajar arduo para brindar una mejor calidad de vida. Liz tiene una trabajo que le permite hacer muchas actividades, su trabajo en si consiste en la venta de salchipapas y hamburguesas por las noches, éste trabajo lo realiza ya por varios años y lo hace en su casa. En los últimos días no estuvo saliendo ya que como recién acaba de ser madre, está en etapa de descanso y reposo, pero estará retomando la actividad en éstos días.  Lleva haciendo éste trabajo por aproximadamente 5 años y lo hace sola, pues así se siente mas tranquila y le permite tener mejores ingresos. Le gusta todo lo que hace, pues le encanta cocinar y siempre está disponible para todo tipo de trabajo ya que también realiza buffets y demás pedidos que le puedan hacer sus clientes, siempre tiene ventas lo cual le permite tener buenos ingresos. Como toda mujer con ganas de surgir, ella tiene muchos planes, pero por el momento solo espera mantener su negocio como va,  ya que siente que está bien por ahora. Este será el crédito número 11 con MFP, está muy contenta de saber que tendrá un préstamo para que pueda cumplir con sus objetivos, por su parte se compromete a ser puntual en sus cuotas y así no quedar mal con el grupo al que pertenece ya que todos son muy responsables y muy buenos. Con el monto solicitado 1000 soles, comprará ingredientes e insumos para continuar con su trabajo, además comprará algunos utensilios que le hace falta cambia para poder hacer su trabajo de manera mas cómoda.
texts.en:
Liz, 36, is a hard-working, cheerful mother of two children, the eldest a son who is 13 and in school, and the youngest a precious little baby girl born just two weeks ago, and another reason for her work hard to give her family a better lifestyle.  Liz has a job that allows her to carry out many activities.  She sells hot dogs and hamburgers in the evenings from her home and has been in business for several years.  She has not been going out lately because she just had her baby and is still taking it easy, although she is planning to start working again soon.

For about five years she has been in business and works alone, because she earns more income.  She enjoys everything she does since she loves to cook and is always available for any kind of work since she also sets up catered buffets and other types of orders she receives from her customers.  Her sales volume always provides a good income.

Like any woman wanting to get ahead, she has many goals, but for now the main thing is staying in business as it is because she is happy with it.  This is her 11th loan through MFP and she is glad to be receiving it to help her meet her objectives.  She is committed to paying it back on time and not fail the group she belongs to because all the members are responsible and kind.  She plans to use the 1,000 PEN to buy food ingredients and supplies to keep on working, as well as new utensils to replace some of the worn out ones, to make her job easier.

loans.use: To buy food ingredients and utensils.

loans.name: Alla Thiakhane De Sare Bilaly Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Alla Thiakhane de Saré Bilaly est créé  le 02 Décembre 2002  au jour de l’inauguration du banc villageois. Il est composé de 14 femmes qui sont toutes issues du même village, très dynamiques  et très déterminées  dans leur activité, ces femmes sont d’un comportement exemplaire. Elles ont comme activité principale le petit commerce.

Madame Fanta  (assise à l’extrême droite et la main droite levée) est responsable du groupe. Elle est âgée de 35 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 03 enfants. 

Elle vend des légumes qu’elle achète à partir des jardins  maraichers de son village pour les revendre au marché central et des marchés environnants, activité qu’elle pratique depuis  2008.

Avec ce prêt elle compte acheter des légumes pour la revente.

Les bénéfices de son activité lui permettront de consolider son épargner  et de soutenir son mari dans la prise en charge de scolarité des enfants.
texts.en:
The group "Alla Thiakhane de Saré Bilaly" was created on December 2, 2002, on the day of the inauguration of the Banc Villageois.  It is made up of 14 women who all come from the same village.  These women are very dynamic and motivated in their work, and their behavior is exemplary.  Their main activity is small business.

Fanta (sitting at the far right in the photo and raising her hand) is the representative of the group.  She is 35 years old, married, and the mother of 3 children.

She buys vegetables from the vegetable gardens of her village, and resells them at the central market or nearby markets.  She has been involved in this activity since 2008.

With her loan, she is planning to buy vegetables for resale.

She will use her profits to strengthen her savings and to help her husband pay for their children's school fees.

loans.use: to buy vegetables for resale.

loans.name: Luisa

texts.es:
Luisa, de 40 años, es una mujer alegre y muy trabajadora, tiene una casa propia en donde comparte con su pareja con quien lleva varios años juntos, además comparten la alegría de educar a sus tres hijos que aun son mayores y dependen de ellos, ella trabaja mucho pues desea brindar una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
El trabajo de Luisa consiste en la venta de pasamanería (sandalias, medias, pomadas, ganchos, etc.) se levanta muy temprano para ir a un mercado ubicado cerca de su casa, en donde tiene dos puestos de venta de pasamanería y calzados. Esta actividad lo realiza sola, y ya van casi tres años consecutivos. Es así que de  lunes a jueves trabaja en su puesto mientras que viernes, sábado y domingo vende en una feria cerca de su casa. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que puede utilizar su tiempo en otras actividades, además de poder compartir parte de su tiempo con sus hijos y su pareja. Siempre tiene clientes y por lo mismo siempre hay buenos ingresos en su economía, ella espera mas adelante ampliar su negocio, poner una tienda completa de ropa pero sabe que tiene que trabajar mucho. Este será el crédito número 2 con MFP, está muy contenta de saber que tendrá un préstamo para que pueda cumplir con sus objetivos, por su parte se compromete a ser puntual en sus cuotas y así no quedar mal con el grupo al que pertenece ya que todos son muy responsables y muy buenos. Con el monto solicitado de 1000 soles, comprará mas mercadería y empezar a aumentar con otros productos, pues tiene muchos pedidos y desea satisfacer a todos sus clientes.
texts.en:
Luisa, 40, is a cheerful, hard-working woman who has her own house where she lives with her common-law husband.  They have been together for several years and share a happy family life educating their three children and working hard to give them a better lifestyle.

Luisa has a stand where she sells sandals, stockings, ointments, hooks, etc.  She gets up early to go to the market near her home where she has two stands, one where she sells notions and the other shoes.  She works alone and has been in business for three years, and her work days are Monday through Thursday at market, and Friday, Saturday and Sunday at the flea-market near her home.  What she likes about her work is the fact that she has time to do other things, as well as spend time with her children and husband.

She always has customers and therefore has a good income.  In the future she wants to expand business and set up a clothing store but she knows that will involve a lot of work.  This is her second loan through MFP and she is glad to be able to count on it to meet her goals.  She is committed to paying it back on time so as not to fail her group since all the members are very responsible and kind.  She plans to use the 1,000 PEN to buy more merchandise and begin increasing her stock.  She has many orders to fill and she wants to keep her customers happy.

loans.use: To buy hooks, stockings, and sandals.

loans.name: Maria Mercedes

texts.es:
La señora María, de Granda, de oficio comerciante. Inicia su tercer crédito Kiva el segundo le ayudo en gran manera ya que le permitió aprovechar la temporada alta de diciembre invirtió en sandalias, perfumes, y comideria. Este nuevo préstamo lo utilizara para invertir en compra de calzado para colegio, también ingredientes para  la comideria.  La apoyan en este nuevo préstamo su hermana quien trabaja  junto con ella de Este nuevo préstamo le ayudara ya que le permitirá invertir y hacer crecer su negocio, mejorar sus  ingresos, nivel de vida ella y su familia.  
Mi siguiente paso es seguir trabajando en su negocio para poder salir adelante.
texts.en: Mrs. María, who is from Granda, is a merchant starting on her third Kiva loan.  Her second loan was of great help in letting her take advantage of the high season in December when she bought sandals, perfumes and food items.  She plans to use this new loan to buy school shoes and food ingredients for her eatery.  In this new loan she is supported by her sister who also works with her.  This loan will help her expand her business, improve her income and give her family a better lifestyle.  She wants to continue working in her business to get ahead.

loans.use: To buy school shoes and food ingredients.

loans.name: Wakilare De Sare Bilaly Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Wakilaré de Saré Bilaly est créé  le 02 Décembre 2002  au jour de l’inauguration du banc villageois. Il est composé de 10 femmes très attachées au culte du travail, elles  sont toutes issues du même Village. Elles ont comme activité principale le petit commerce.

Madame Siré (assise à l’extrême droite) est responsable du groupe. Elle est âgée de 48 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 06 enfants. Elle est vendeuse de fruits et légumes suivant les saisons, elle jouit d’une très bonne maîtrise de son activé pour l’avoir pratiqué depuis plus de quinze années. 

Avec ce prêt elle compte s’approvisionner en orange en quantité en vu de la revente sur.

Les bénéfices de son activité lui permettront d’épargner  en partie  et  de soutenir son mari dans la prise en charge alimentaire et scolaire.
texts.en: The group Wakilaré de Saré Bilaly was formed on December 2, 2002 on the same day of the inauguration of the banc villageois. The group is comprised of 10 women who are dedicated to the sanctity of their work. They are all from the same village. Their main activity is small business. Madame Siré (seated at right) is in charge of the group. She is 48 years old. She is married and is the mother of 6 children. She sells seasonal fruits and vegetables, and has good mastery of her work since she's been doing it for more than 15 years. She will use this loan to buy large quantities of oranges for resale. The income from her work will allow her save money and help her husband with food and schooling costs.

loans.use: to buy oranges for resale.

loans.name: Mirna

texts.es:
Mirna, de 55 años, es una mujer trabajadora y muy responsable, es viuda y por este motivo tuvo que criar sola a sus dos hijos de 32 y  20 años, ellos ya son mayores e independientes en lo económico, pero aun vive con ellos en su casa propia. Ella tiene a su cargo a su nieto de 1 año. Trabaja mucho pues desea tener una mejor calidad de vida y una vejez tranquila. Mirna, tiene como trabajo el de la venta de comida por las noches en su casa, de lunes a sábado, mientras que los domingo y feriados ella vende cebiche y parrillada. Lleva ya cuatro años en este negocio y desde que se inicio con su negocio ha crecido  mucho en su economía y por eso sigue con ese trabajo. Le gusta su trabajo por que tiene tiempo para poder ayudar a su hijo en el cuidado de su nieto, además de poder hacer otras actividades en su hogar, como toda mujer emprendedora tiene muchos planes a futuro y aunque ya avanzo mucho pues desea seguir creciendo. Ahora desea refaccionar los ambiente de su casa que es en donde atiende a sus clientes, además desea invertir en un nuevo negocio. Este será el crédito numero 7 con la institución MFP, por tanto espera de su colaboración, para continuar con sus objetivos, además esta muy decidida en cumplir con sus pagos como lo hizo hasta hora en sus créditos anteriores. Le agrada mucho pertenecer al grupo al que pertenece ya que son muy puntuales y responsables.
Con el monto solicitado 1000 soles, comprará materiales y madera para refaccionar su local.
texts.en:
Mirna, 55, is a hard-working, responsible woman.  She is a widow and raised her two children alone.  Now they are 32 and 20 and economically independent, but they still live at home.  She takes care of a one-year-old grandson and works hard for a better lifestyle and quiet retirement.  Mirna runs a diner out of her home in the evenings from Monday to Saturday.  On Sundays and holidays she sells "cebiche" (fish dish) and grilled food.  She has been in business for four years and it has grown considerably so she keeps on working.  She enjoys her job because it allows her to help her son with her grandson, while also taking care of other household activities.  Being an enterprising woman, she has many plans for the future; and even though she has been able to get ahead, there is still room to grow.

Now she wants to begin heating the area in her house where she attends to customers, and she wants to set up a new business.  This is her seventh loan through the MFP institution and she is counting on your support to continue with her goals.  She is committed to paying back the loan on time as she has done with previous loans.  She enjoys being in her communal bank because all the members are punctual and responsible.

She plans to use the 1,000 PEN loan to buy supplies and firewood to heat her diner.

loans.use: To buy supplies and firewood for her diner.

loans.name: Afia De Diatamine Safere Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Afia de Diatamine Saféré est créé en décembre 2008 à l'inauguration du BV. Il  compte 27 femmes très engagées dans leur travail, il existe une vive solidarité dans le groupe. Les femmes  habitent le même village et mènent toutes des activités dans le petit commerce.

Madame Kadiatou (assise au milieux du groupe avec la main levée) est responsable du groupe. Elle est mariée et mère de six enfants. C’est une femme très active dans la transformation des produits locaux en l’occurrence les graines d'arachide en pâte. Avec ses 61 ans elle jouit d’une bonne expérience de cette activité pour l’avoir pratiqué pendant plusieurs années.

Ce prêt lui permettra d’acheter des graines d'arachide en quantité en vue de la transformation en pâte pour la revente dans les marchés hebdomadaires des villages environnants. 

Les retombées de ses activités lui permettront de mieux assister son époux dans les charges familiales.
texts.en:
The group Afia de Diatamine Saféré was founded in December 2008 with the inauguration of the banc villageois. There are 27 women in the group who are very engaged in their work, and there is a lively solidarity in the group. 

All the women live in the same village, and they all work in small business. Madame Kadiatou (seated in the middle with her hand raised) is in charge of the group. She is married and is the mother of 6 children. She's very active in the transformation of local products - currently she's turning peanuts into peanut butter. She's 61, and has a solid experience in this activity as she's been doing it for many years. 

This loan will allow her to buy peanuts in large quantities. She'll turn the peanuts into peanut butter that she'll sell in the weekly markets in surrounding villages. The income from her work will allow her to better help her husband with the family expenses

loans.use: to buy peanuts

loans.name: Komlanvi

texts.fr:
Komlanvi est un homme âgé de 32 ans. Il est marié à une couturière et a 03 enfants.
Komlanvi travaille comme tapissier et vendeur de meubles  depuis 2004.  Il exerce son activité avec 02personnes dans un atelier. Il achète les bois à AHEPE(une localité située au Nord-est de Lomé) 
Komlanvi a requis son troisième  crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des bois. Son désir est de se perfectionner plus dans son métier afin de mieux servir sa clientèle.
texts.en:
Komlanvi, age 32, is married to a seamstress and has three children. Since 2004, he's been working as an upholsterer and furniture seller.

He runs his business in a workshop along with two other persons. He purchases wood in Ahepe, a village located northeast of Lomé.

Komlanvi is seeking his third loan from Kiva's partner, WAGES, in order to buy wood. He wishes to perfect his professional skills in order to better serve his clientele.

loans.use: to buy wood

loans.name: Saqer

texts.en:
Saqer is a 35 year old man who he is a father with one son and three daughters. For the past 15 years, Saqer has had a grocery store selling groceries and also fruits and vegetables to customers. It has been a profitable project, but not enough to cover the family's costs and needs.

Saqer is requesting a 3,000 USD loan from FATEN to help him cover the costs of purchasing a stock of groceries and bulk of fruits and vegetables that customers often request. This will offer to Saqer better products to resell and this will lead to increase sales and improve the family's income. Saqer is photographed in the grocery store he owns.

loans.use: To purchase a stock of groceries and bulk of fruits and vegetables to resell

loans.name: Reyna

texts.es: Reyna, de 55 años, es una mujer muy alegre y amable, está casada ya hace varios años, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo y un nieto a quien cría y desea brindar una mejor calidad de vida. El trabajo de Reyna es el de realizar costura, tiene una taller pequeño pero muy bien instalado en su casa, ahí hace trabajos por encargo o cuando no tiene ningún encargo hace sus propios diseños y creaciones para poder vender a sus clientes, quienes siempre van en busca de un nuevo modelo y diseño para comprar. Leva haciendo este trabajo desde muy joven, ya que su madre le enseñó todo lo que sabe y desde ahí se dedico a trabajar en esta actividad. Lo hace sola y esta contenta de trabajar en eso. Este será el crédito número 7 con MFP, por tanto espera de su colaboración para continuar con sus objetivos, por otro lado ella se compromete en seguir siendo una socia puntual y cumplida como en los créditos anteriores que tuvo, además desea seguir trabajando con los socios de su banco comunal ya que todos son muy amables y solidarios. Con el monto solicitado 1700 soles, comprará materiales para continuar con su trabajo, además comprará una maquina de coser ya que desea implementarse para tener un mejor acabado en su trabajo.
texts.en:
Reyna, aged 55, is a very cheerful and friendly woman. She was married several years ago and lives now in her own house with her husband and a grandson, whom she raises and to whom she wants to offer a better quality of life.

Reyna is a seamstress, working at home in a small but well-equipped workshop. Here she does commissioned work or, when she has no customer order, makes self-designed clothes and creations and sells them to customers, who are always on the lookout for new models and design garments to buy. Reyna has done this work since a very young age. She was taught the craft by her mother and has been in this line of business ever since. She works alone and is happy with her situation.

This will be her seventh loan with the microfinance institution Microfinanzas Prisma. She expects to continue her collaboration with the institution to pursue her objectives. On the other hand, she promises to pay off her loan punctually on schedule, just as she did with her previous loans. In addition, she wants to keep on working with the other members of her communal bank, because they are all very friendly and supportive people.

Reyna will use the 1700 new soles of her loan to buy sewing supplies to continue her work. She will also buy a sewing machine, because she wants to sew clothes with a better finishing.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine and supplies for her workshop.

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is a 24-year-old man. He is married with no children yet. For the past year, Ahmad has distributed home gas tanks to customers, which has been a profitable project.

Ahmad is requesting a 3,000 USD youth loan from FATEN to add to his own money to purchase a pick-up truck. He will use the truck for distributing home gas tanks to customers' homes. This will enable Ahmad to expand his work and give his customers quick service, which will lead to increased sales and higher income. Ahmad is photographed in the picture.

loans.use: To purchase a pick-up truck for distributing home gas tanks to customers

loans.name: Shadi

texts.en:
Shadi is a 23-year-old young man.  His father is a worker and his brother works in agriculture, both are getting low salaries that are not enough to cover the family's needs and pay the education expenses. 

Shadi is studying at the university, specializing in Finance.  He wants to complete his studies, so he is requesting a loan from FATEN to help him cover the university fees.  This will ensure a better future for Shadi and improve his family's living conditions. Shadi is photographed in the picture.

loans.use: pay university fees

loans.name: Nidaa

texts.en:
Nidaa is a 41-year-old woman. She is a mother with two sons and four daughters. Her husband is a worker who earns a low salary that is not enough to cover the family's needs and pay their education expenses. 

Two of Nidaa's daughters are studying at the university. One is specializing in English Language and the other in Accounting. Nidaa wants to help her daughters to complete their studies by paying their university fees, so she is requesting a US $1,500 loan from FATEN to help her daughters cover the university fees. This will ensure a better future for her daughters and improve the family's living conditions. Nidaa is photographed in the picture.

loans.use: To pay the university fees for two of her daughters.

loans.name: Montaser

texts.en:
Montaser is a 19-year-old single young man.  His father is a worker with a low salary.  For the past one year, Montaser has been running a grocery store, which has been a profitable project and the only source of income for him.

Montaser is requesting a 3,000 USD loan from FATEN to help him cover the cost of purchasing a collection of groceries to resell to customers so he will have better collection for sale. This will increase sales and improve his income. Montaser is photographed in the grocery store he owns.

loans.use: stock his grocery store

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is a 30-year-old young man, and he is married with two sons. He is a worker with a low salary, which is not enough to cover the family's costs and expenses. 
Mohammad is requesting a 1,500 USD youth loan from FATEN to help him pay his son's medical expenses, who is suffering from a disease. This will improve Mohammad's son health to better enable him to live in normal conditions with the family. Mohammad is photographed in the picture.

loans.use: to pay his son's medical expenses.

loans.name: Waseem

texts.en:
Waseem is a 21-year-old single man. His father gets a pension salary, but not enough to cover the family's needs. For the past four years, Waseem has been raising and selling sheep and sheep products, which has been a profitable project.

Waseem is requesting a 3,000 USD loan from FATEN to help him cover the costs of purchasing more sheep and expanding and improving the herd's condition. This will increase sales and improve the family's income. Waseem is photographed in the picture.

loans.use: To purchase more sheep

loans.name: Azza

texts.en:
Azza is a 24-year-old young woman. She is married and has two sons. Her husband is employed who earns a low salary, which is not enough to cover the family's needs and to pay their education costs.

Azza is studying at the university, specializing in English Literature. Azza wants to complete her studies, so she is requesting a US $1,000 loan from FATEN to help her cover the university fees. This will ensure a better future for Azza and improve her family's living conditions. Azza is photographed in the picture.

loans.use: To pay her university fees.

loans.name: Ayman

texts.en: Ayman is a 27-year-old single young man.  He is a construction worker and gets low salary, which is not enough to cover his daily costs. Ayman is requesting a 1,000 USD loan from FATEN to help him cover the cost of finishing his house, such as installing tiles and installing doors and windows. This will improve Ayman's house and enable him to live in better home conditions. Ayman is photographed in the picture.

loans.use: pay the costs of finishing his house

loans.name: Kifah

texts.en:
Kifah is a conservative person who prefers not to have her photo published online, so her husband Shareef appears in her Kiva profile photo.

Kifah is 25 years old and married. Her husband, who we see here, is a Ministry of Labor employee who earns a low salary which is not enough to cover the family's needs. For the past three years, he has also been raising and selling sheep and sheep products, which has been a profitable project. She is requesting a $3,000 youth loan from FATEN to help her husband cover the costs of buying more sheep and improving the herd's condition. This will increase sales and raise the family's income.

loans.use: to buy more sheep and improve the herd's condition.

loans.name: Fawzya

texts.en:
Fawzya is a conservative person who prefers not to have her photo published online, so her mother Eman appears in her Kiva profile photo.

Fawzya is a 19-year-old single young woman. Her father is employed who earns a low salary.  He also has been raising and selling sheep and sheep products and he works in agriculture, which have been profitable projects.

Fawzya is requesting a youth loan from FATEN to help her family cover the costs of purchasing a new greenhouse to prepare for the new agricultural season and to improve the farm's condition. This will offer to the family the chance to prepare well for the coming agricultural season.  It will also help them get a better crop, increase sales, and improve their income.

loans.use: To purchase a new greenhouse to prepare for the new agricultural season.

loans.name: Baker

texts.en:
Baker is a 29 year old young man. For the past three years, Baker has been operating a vehicle repairs workshop, which has been a profitable project, but also not enough to cover his cost of living.

Baker is requesting a 1,500 USD loan from FATEN to help him cover the costs of purchasing new vehicle repair kit. This will improve Baker's work quality and increase demand from his customers to repair their vehicles. This will increase his income and offer to him better living conditions. Baker is photographed in the workshop.

loans.use: to purchase new vehicle repairs kit.

loans.name: Emad

texts.en:
Emad is a 26 years old single young man.  For the past three years, Emad has had a grocery store selling different types of groceries.  It has been a profitable project, but not enough to cover the costs.

Emad is requesting a 2,000 USD youth loan from FATEN to help him cover the costs of purchasing needed stock of basic groceries that customers often request such as rice, sugar and  milk, and to make improvements in the store's condition such as: installing additional shelves and painting. This will increase sales  and increase Emad's income.
Emad is photographed in the grocery store he owns.

loans.use: To purchase collection of groceries and improve the store's condition

loans.name: Binta

texts.fr: Madame Binta habite au Sénégal. Elle est mariée et âgée de 57 ans. Elle est mère de 4 enfants dont l’âge  varie entre 17 et 40 ans. Elle s’active depuis  plus de 30 ans dans le secteur du commerce. Elle exerce l’achat et la vente d’huile de palme et de bouillie de mil. Elle a choisi cette activité par passion et  dans le souci d’épauler son mari dans les charges familiales. C’est surtout les bénéfices qui l’intéressent  le plus. Elle est sociétaire de l’un des guichets de l’U-IMCEC depuis octobre 2005. Elle a déjà remboursé  4 prêts  antérieurs et emprunte 200 000 frs ,montant avec lequel elle compte s’approvisionner  en huile de palme pour les besoins de son commerce. Son objectif est de renforcer son fond de roulement, accroitre ses bénéfices et contribuer a l’amélioration de la situation sociale de sa  famille.
texts.en:
Mrs. Binta, age 57, lives in Senegal. She's married and the mother of four children, whose ages range from 17 to 40.

She's been a merchant for more than thirty years. She buys and sells palm oil and millet porridge.

She choose this business out of passion, and also to help her husband in taking care of the family's expenses. She's mostly interested in profits.

She's been a member of one of UIMCEC's local branches since October 2005, and already repaid four previous loans.

She's now seeking a loan of XOF 200'000, to be used to get palm oil supplies for her business. Her goal is to bolster her working capital, increase her profits, and contribute to improving her family's social standard.

loans.use: to buy palm oil supplies

loans.name: Yousef

texts.en:
Yousef is a twenty-four-year-old single young man. For the past two years, Yousef has run a grocery store in an area with a lot of movement. It has been a profitable project.

Yousef is requesting a 2,000 USD loan from FATEN to help him cover the costs of purchasing a collection of groceries that his customers usually ask for. This includes rice, sugar and canned food. This will increase sales and improve Yousef's income.

Yousef is photographed in his grocery store.

loans.use: To purchase a collection of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Kholoud

texts.en:
Kholoud is a conservative woman who prefers not to have her photo published online, so her husband appears in her Kiva profile photo.

Kholoud is a young woman, twenty-four years of age. She is married with two sons. Her husband is employed who gets a salary, but it is low and not enough to cover the family's costs.

Kholoud is requesting a 2,000 USD loan from FATEN to help her cover the costs of finishing a bathroom and kitchen, including installing tiles, installing sinks and painting. This will improve the family's living conditions and provide the family members with a suitable kitchen and bathroom to use.

loans.use: To complete finishing a bathroom and kitchen.

loans.name: Motee

texts.en: Motee is 31 years old, married and has two sons. He is a construction worker, but his salary is low and not enough to cover the family's needs and pay its education expenses. His sons are students at a primary school, and he wants to help them to complete their primary studies by paying their school fees. To do this, he is requesting a $2,000 loan from FATEN. This will ensure a better future for his sons and improve the family's living conditions. Motee is photographed in the picture.

loans.use: to pay his son's school fees.

loans.name: Noor

texts.en:
Noor is a conservative woman who prefers not to have her photo published online, so her husband appears in her Kiva profile photo and is pictured in the mobile store he has.

Noor is a 23-year-old woman. She is married with three sons and two daughters. Her husband is a Palestinian National Authority employee who gets a low salary that is not enough to cover the family's costs. For the past two years, Noor's husband has had a store selling mobile phones and accessories; it has been a profitable project.

Noor is requesting a $2,000 USD loan from FATEN to help her husband cover the costs of purchasing a collection of mobile phones and accessories. This will increase sales and improve the family's income.

loans.use: To purchase a collection of mobile phones and accessories.

loans.name: Aliaa

texts.en:
Aliaa is a conservative woman who prefers not to have her photo published online, so her husband, Issa, appears in her Kiva profile photo.

Aliaa is a 30-year-old woman. She is married and her husband is a Palestinian National Authority employee who gets a low salary that is not enough to cover the family's costs.

Aliaa is requesting a 1,500 USD loan from FATEN to help her cover the costs of purchasing some necessary home furniture such as living room furniture and dinning room furniture. This will improve the family's living conditions.

loans.use: To purchase new home furniture.

loans.name: Ghazaleh

texts.en:
Ghazaleh is a conservative person who prefers not to have her photo published online, so her husband Hasan appears in her Kiva profile photo.

Ghazaleh is a 43-year-old woman who is married with one son. Her husband is employed, buy gets a low salary that is not enough to cover the family's expenses.

Ghazaleh is requesting a youth loan from FATEN to help her cover the costs of purchasing new home furniture such as bedroom furniture for her son and living room seats. This will offer her family better and more suitable home furniture and will let them live in better conditions.


About this loan product:
FATEN offers loans that are customized for Muslim borrowers. A key principle of Islam is the prohibition of charging interest on a loan. This prohibition is based on the belief that money is only a medium of exchange and has no value in itself. In order to offer loans in a manner that is consistent with borrowers' values, FATEN charges 0% interest on this loan. However, FATEN does charge a servicing fee to cover its costs. The loan amount you see listed on Kiva includes both the principal loan and the loan servicing fees. As with all Kiva loans, you should expect to have your funds returned to you according to this loan’s repayment schedule. For more information on lending in the Muslim world, please click here.

loans.use: To purchase new home furniture

loans.name: Maysaa

texts.en:
Maysaa is a conservative woman who prefers not to have her photo published online, so her husband Khaleel appears in her Kiva profile photo.

Maysaa is 25-year-old young woman. She is married and her husband is employed, but with a low salary. His salary is not enough to cover the family's needs and to pay for completing their house.

Maysaa is requesting a 1,500 USD youth loan from FATEN to help her cover the costs of completing her house, including expenses such as installing tiles, installing windows and doors, and painting. This will improve the condition of the house and create better living conditions for the family.

loans.use: To pay for completing the house

loans.name: Israa

texts.en:
Israa is a 25-year-old young woman. She is the mother of one daughter and her husband is a construction worker who earns a small salary which is not enough to cover the family's needs. 

To be able to support her family, Israa started her own kindergarten four years ago, and it has been a profitable project. Israa came to FATEN and received a $2,000 loan to help her cover the costs of purchasing new kindergarten equipment such as chairs, healthy toys, tables and educational items for the children. Israa wants to improve the family's financial situation and secure her children's future.

loans.use: To purchase necessary kindergarten equipment

loans.name: Marwan

texts.en:
Marwan is a 27-year-old single young man. His father and his mother are workers in a local chocolate factory, and their small salaries are not enough to cover the family's needs. For the past two years, Marwan has been raising and selling sheep and sheep products, which has been a profitable project. Marwan wants to expand his project by purchasing an additional number of sheep. He is requesting a youth loan from FATEN to help him cover the costs as he has gained a respected number of customers. This expansion will increase sales and improve the family's income.

Marwan is photographed in his project.

About this loan product:
FATEN offers loans that are customized for Muslim borrowers. A key principle of Islam is the prohibition of charging interest on a loan. This prohibition is based on the belief that money is only a medium of exchange and has no value in itself. In order to offer loans in a manner that is consistent with borrowers' values, FATEN charges 0% interest on this loan. However, FATEN does charge a servicing fee to cover its costs. The loan amount you see listed on Kiva includes both the principal loan and the loan servicing fees. As with all Kiva loans, you should expect to have your funds returned to you according to this loan’s repayment schedule. For more information on lending in the Muslim world, please click here.

loans.use: To increase his number of sheep

loans.name: Ayman

texts.en:
Ayman is a 23-year-old single young man. For the past two years Ayman has been using a rickshaw for selling used goods and home appliances. It has been a profitable project and his only source of income.

Ayman is requesting a youth loan from FATEN to help him cover the expenses necessary for insuring and licensing the rickshaw. This will validate the rickshaw and enable Ayman to move from one area to another more easily, leading to increased sales and improving Ayman's income.

Ayman is photographed in the picture.

loans.use: To pay for insuring and licensing his rickshaw

loans.name: Nader

texts.en:
Nader is a 27-year-old young man. He is married with one son. Nader has two jobs, one during the day and also has been a taxi driver, but in both jobs he has received low salaries insufficient for covering the family's needs and medical expenses.

Nader is requesting a loan from FATEN to help him cover the medical expenses needed to cure himself from a disease he is suffering from. This loan will enable Nader to cure himself and live with his family in a better, healthier condition. 

Nader is photographed in the picture.


About this loan product:
FATEN offers loans that are customized for Muslim borrowers. A key principle of Islam is the prohibition of charging interest on a loan. This prohibition is based on the belief that money is only a medium of exchange and has no value in itself. In order to offer loans in a manner that is consistent with borrowers' values, FATEN charges 0% interest on this loan. However, FATEN does charge a servicing fee to cover its costs. The loan amount you see listed on Kiva includes both the principal loan and the loan servicing fees. As with all Kiva loans, you should expect to have your funds returned to you according to this loan’s repayment schedule. For more information on lending in the Muslim world, please click here.

loans.use: To pay for his medical expenses

loans.name: Abdulrahman

texts.en:
Abdulrahman is a 28 years old young man. He is married and a father with two sons. He is a Palestinian National Authority employee who gets low salary which is not enough to cover the family's expenses.
Abdulrahman is requesting a youth loan from FATEN to help him cover the costs of purchasing necessary home furniture such as: bedroom furniture for his sons and living room chairs. Taking this loan will offer to Abdulrahman's family comfortable home furniture and improve their living conditions.
Abdulrahman is photographed in the picture.


About this loan product:
FATEN offers loans that are customized for Muslim borrowers. A key principle of Islam is the prohibition of charging interest on a loan. This prohibition is based on the belief that money is only a medium of exchange and has no value in itself. In order to offer loans in a manner that is consistent with borrowers' values, FATEN charges 0% interest on this loan. However, FATEN does charge a servicing fee to cover its costs. The loan amount you see listed on Kiva includes both the principal loan and the loan servicing fees. As with all Kiva loans, you should expect to have your funds returned to you according to this loan’s repayment schedule. For more information on lending in the Muslim world, please click here.

loans.use: To purchase some necessary home furniture.

loans.name: Ayman

texts.en:
Ayman is a 27-year-old young man. He is married with no children yet. He is a municipal employee who gets a low salary. Ayman wanted to increase his income, so two years ago he started a small venture raising and selling sheep and sheep products. Now as Ayman has gained a number of customers through friends and neighbors, he decided to expand his venture by increasing the number of sheep he is raising in addition to purchasing poultry. So, he is requesting a 1,500 USD youth loan from FATEN to help him cover these costs of purchasing more sheep and poultry. In the future, Ayman wants to build up a herd. Taking this loan will increase sales and improve the family's income.
Ayman is photographed in the picture.

loans.use: To purchase more sheep and poultry

loans.name: Amal

texts.en:
Amal is a conservative person who prefers not to have her photo published online, so her husband appears in her Kiva profile photo.

Amal is a young woman, aged twenty-five. She is a mother with three daughters. Her husband is an employee of the Palestinian National Authority. He gets low salary, which is not enough to cover the family's needs and costs.

Amal is requesting a 1,500 USD youth loan from FATEN to help her cover the costs of purchasing new bedroom furniture. This will improve Amal's living conditions as she will have comfortable furniture in her house.

loans.use: To purchase new bedroom furniture.

loans.name: C9232 Twisungane Group

texts.en:
Donatha is 38 years old and married. She has operated a well-organized business with six years of experience, selling sorghum and beans at her market. She works from 8 a.m. until 8 p.m. every day. Donatha is the president of this group, which is called "C9232 Twisungane" in the local language. She is the first person on the right side of the photo. 

Donatha has requested a loan from Kiva partner, Vision Finance Company, in order to expand her business by buying more sorghum and beans to sell. She will use the profit from this loan to reinvest in her business and to save for her future.

loans.use: To purchase more sorghum and beans to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To purchase a car for his business.

loans.name: Ohoud

texts.en:
Ohoud, 25 years old, is a married lady. She has three kids.

For a year now, Ohoud has been running a small retail business selling blankets and clothes. The products she sells may differ based on the season and the market demand. Now, Ohoud has applied for a youth loan to increase her inventory of clothes to increase her profits and open her own shop.

loans.use: to increase her inventory of clothes

loans.name: Jumana

texts.en:
Jumana, a 29-year-old single lady, lives with her parents and siblings. 

Three years ago, Jumana and her brother made a partnership to open a shop, so they chose to start a business selling cosmetics products and make-up. Jumana is the one who works at the shop. 

Now she wants to separate from her brother and have her own shop, so she has applied for a loan to do so and to enhance the shop's decoration.

loans.use: to enhance the shop's decoration.

loans.name: Thaer

texts.en:
Thaer is a 22-year-old single man. He is the oldest of five siblings.
Thaer is a computer science student in his third year at university. To be able to support the family, Thaer's father started to work as a taxi driver after his retirement. Thaer wants to continue his studies but because of a shortage of money he has applied for a loan to pay his semester fees.

loans.use: pay his semester fees.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to bring in more mobiles and increase his inventory

loans.name: Iman

texts.en:
Iman, a 23-year-old single lady, lives with her mother and two siblings; their father passed away. 

Iman is a university student in her last year, majoring in civil engineering. She has applied for a loan to pay for the semester's fees so she can graduate and find a suitable job to help her family in improving their living conditions.

loans.use: to pay for the semester's school fees

loans.name: Arwa

texts.en:
Arwa, 22 years old and a single lady, is the oldest among four brothers and sisters.

Arwa is studying the English language at the university; she wants to become a teacher after graduation. She has applied for a loan to pay her semester fees.

loans.use: to pay her semester fees.

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en:
Ibrahim, a 22-year-old single guy, is the oldest among his eight siblings. 

Ibrahim works in a shop making sweets; he is also a student in one of the Jordanian colleges majoring in accounting. Ibrahim uses his salary to cover his daily expenses and to pay his semester’s fees.

After getting his diploma from the college, he intends to continue to get a Bachelor's degree in the same major. Unfortunately, Ibrahim was not able to save for his next semester fees due to some family issues, so he has applied for a loan in order to pay the semester fees.

loans.use: to pay his semester fees

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is a 24-year-old single guy. He lives with his parents and his four siblings.

Ahmad opened his own shop for selling mobile phones and phone accessories. This was five years ago. Now Ahmad has applied for a youth loan to increase his shop inventory of phones and phone accessories.

loans.use: to increase his inventory of phones and phone accessories

loans.name: Nour

texts.en:
Nour, 20 years old and a single lady, is living with her parents and siblings. She is the oldest among four brothers and sisters. Her father is a self-employed taxi driver.

Nour is a university student majoring in finance and banking. Since she is the oldest, Nour wants to graduate as soon as she can so she can help her father to get all of her siblings into colleges.

She has applied for a loan in order to pay her semester’s fees.

loans.use: to pay for her semester’s fees

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is a 23-year-old single man. He has five brothers and sisters.
Mohammad is a university student in his last year of studying chemistry. He hopes that after graduation he will find a job in the field. Mohammad has applied for a loan to pay his semester fees.

loans.use: to pay his semester fees.

loans.name: Adham

texts.en:
Adham is a 21-year-old single guy, He has three brothers and one sister.

Adham wanted to study, so he started working in a hospital to save up money. He registered in the University to study Economics. But Adham faced a money shortage when he went to pay for the fee, so he has applied for a loan in order to do so.

loans.use: to pay for his semester fees

loans.name: Majeda

texts.en:
Majeda is a 51-year-old housewife and a mother of six sons and daughters.
Majeda used to work for the Ministry of Education before she retired; her husband has also retired from one of the governmental entities. They use their retirement salaries, and are helped by their eldest child who works as a male nurse to support the family. 
Now one of their daughters has entered university, and Majeda wants to make sure that she finishes and graduates in order to start working in her field. For this purpose, Majeda has applied for a loan in order to pay her daughter's semester fees.

loans.use: to pay her daughter's semester fees.

loans.name: Qusai

texts.en:
Qusai is a 22-year-old single guy. His mother is a housewife, and his father is a translator. 

Qusai is a second year student in the university majoring in Business Administration; he is also in his last year to get a diploma in Mechanics. With his ambitious and hard work Qusai is now looking forward to getting his bachelor degree and starting work in the field to apply what he studied and gain experience. 

He has applied for loan to pay the semester's fees at the university.

loans.use: to pay the fees for a semester at the university

loans.name: Musaab

texts.en:
Musaab, a 21 years old single guy, lives with his parents in Al Karak, a city southern Jordan.

Musaab, is studying Tourism in one of the Jordanian Universities. He has applied for a loan to pay for his semester’s fees so he can graduate as soon as possible and find a job to support his parents and himself.

loans.use: to pay for his semester’s fees

loans.name: Sawsan

texts.en:
Because Sawsan is a conservative person, she asked her son Qusai to take the photo instead.

Sawsan is a 48-year-old married lady. She has three sons and a daughter.

Sawsan has two sons studying in the university; one of them is Qusai who appears in the photo. He is majoring in planning and managerial studies. The other one, Ahmad, has joined the military and is studying accounting on the side.

Sawsan has applied for a loan to pay for both of her sons’ semester fees.

loans.use: to pay for both of her sons’ semester fees.

loans.name: Nour

texts.en:
Nour is a conservative person, so she asked her brother Khaled to appear in the photo instead of her. 

Nour is a 21-year-old single lady who wants to support her brother Khaled in his studies and help him to graduate. Khaled works as a cashier in one of the largest malls in Amman, he also is a university student majoring in accounting systems. 

Nour has applied for this loan to help him pay the registration fees for the university so he can continue his education.

loans.use: To pay for her brother's semester's fees.

loans.name: Suad

texts.en:
Suad is a conservative person, so she asked her son Ammar to take the photo instead.

Suad, a 44-year-old married lady, is married to a driver. They have three sons and a daughter.

One of their sons, Ammar, who is the eldest, is studying applied physics in the university to become a physics teacher in the future. His mother, Suad, has applied for this loan in order to pay for her son’s semester fees so he can continue studying.

loans.use: to pay for her son’s semester fees.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad, a 23-year-old single man, is the youngest of his four siblings.

Mohammad is a student in a private university, trying to get a bachelor's degree, so he applied for a loan to pay for his semester’s fees.

Mohammad hopes that after graduation he will find a suitable job that can provide him with a good salary and a good experience for his future.

loans.use: to pay for his semester’s fees.

loans.name: Amal

texts.en:
Amal is a conservative person, so she asked her daughter to appear in the photo instead. 

Amal is a 46-year-old housewife. She is married to Mohammad, who works for the Ministry of Education. Amal and her husband have six sons and daughters; one of their daughters is married. 

Her second daughter Ansam, who appears in the photo, is a university student majoring in Marketing, which is a field that she loves and wants to work in. 

Amal wants to help her husband and her daughter, so she has applied for a loan to pay for the fees for a semester at the university.

loans.use: to pay for a semester at the university for her daughter

loans.name: Nimer

texts.en:
Nimer is a 20-year-old single man. He is the eldest among his five brothers and sisters.

Nimer is an IT student at one of the Jordanian universities, making his way to graduation and after that, higher education studies in the same field. 

He has applied for a loan now to pay for his registration fees.

loans.use: to pay for his registration fees.

loans.name: Waad

texts.en:
Waad, 22 years old, is a single lady. She lives with her parents and three siblings.

Waad is an accounting student at one of the Jordanian universities. Since she is the oldest, she wants to study hard to be a good role model for her siblings and she wants to find a good job in the future to apply what she has studied. 

Waad has applied for a loan to pay for her semester’s fees.

loans.use: to pay for her semester’s fees

loans.name: Bashar

texts.en:
Bashar is 21 years old and single. He is a university student studying Managerial Information Systems. Because of his financial circumstances, Bashar wants to graduate as soon as possible to help with the family's financial situation.
 
He has applied for a loan to pay for his semester fees to get his Bachelors degree as soon as he can.

loans.use: to pay for his semester fees

loans.name: Asmaa

texts.en: Asmaa, a 24-year-old married lady, has two children. Her husband works for the government. Asmaa wants to provide her kids with the best life she can offer them, so she decided to work hard to achieve that. She started to make pickles to sell:  pepper pickles, cucumber pickles, olive pickles, lemon pickles and others. Now Asmaa has applied for a youth loan to add new kinds of pickles from other vegetables.

loans.use: to add new kinds of pickles from other vegetables

loans.name: Siham

texts.en:
Siham is a conservative person so she asked her daughter Sabaa to take her place in the photo.

Siham, a 50-year-old housewife, is married to Zuhair who has recently retired from the military. They have six sons and daughters.

Her eldest Sabaa, a 19-year-old single lady, is a managerial student at the university. She is still a new student hoping to graduate as soon as possible and be a good role model for the rest of her siblings. 
 
Siham has applied for a loan to pay for her daughter’s university fees.

loans.use: to pay for her daughter’s university fees

loans.name: Ahlam

texts.en:
Ahlam is a 26-year-old divorced lady and the mother of one boy.
 
Since Ahlam is depending on herself to survive life and to support her child, she insists on continuing to get a Bachelor's degree to find a more suitable job for her. At the same time, Ahlam works at two jobs. One of the jobs is a secretary in a lawyer’s office. The other is in her small food shop in the neighborhood where she sells kid's snacks and candy.  

Ahlam has now applied for a loan to pay for her semester fees since she is in the last year before graduation.

loans.use: to pay for her semester fees

loans.name: Banaz

texts.en:
Banaz is a 22 years old, married, young Iraqi woman. She has been using her sewing skills for 4 years as a means to help out with supporting her family. 

In the past she successfully applied, received, and repaid a Relief International Microfinance Iraq loan which she used for buying a small generator to allow her to work during the hours when the city had no electricity. 

Banaz took a loan from Relief International Microfinance Iraq in the amount of 2700 USD to renew her work area and purchase more fabric and raw materials. 

Banaz is 22, and qualifies for a 'youth loan'.

Based on the political and social challenges of lending in Iraq, personally identifiable information about this borrower has been altered for their protection. RI-Iraq appreciates Kiva lenders' consideration of these challenges and encourages lenders to continue their support for Iraqi borrowers.

loans.use: to renew her work area and purchase more fabric and raw materials.

loans.name: Arwa

texts.en:
Because Arwa is a conservative woman, she asked her son Hamzah to take her place.
Arwa is a 47-year-old married woman. She has five sons and daughters. Her eldest is Hamzah, a 21-year-old single man. He is a university student majoring in chemistry. 
Hamzah wants to graduate as soon as possible to help his father in supporting the family by finding a job in the same field. In order to do so, his mother, Arwa, has applied for a loan to pay for his upcoming semester.

loans.use: to pay for her son's upcoming semester

loans.name: Sope Serign Mbacké Sokhna Lo Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité Sope Serign Mbacké Sokhna Lo a été crée depuis le premier cycle  du BV. Il regroupe actuellement 7 membres habitant le même village et s'activant dans le petit commerce comme activité principale

Madame Astou (debout à gauche de la photo) est responsable du groupe de solidarité. Elle âgée de 63 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 09 enfants.

Elle développe une activité de petit commerce de céréales depuis plusieurs années

Avec son nouveau crédit elle va se procurer de la marchandise (arachide et mil) qu 'elle va revendre au niveau du petit marché de son village.

Avec ses bénéfices elle parvient à payer les fournitures scolaires pour ses enfants mais également des habits lors des fêtes religieuses.
texts.en:
The solidarity group Sope Serigan Mbacké Sokhna Lo has been in existence since the first cycle of the banc villageois. It is currently comprised of seven members who live in the same village and who engage in small trade as their primary activity. 

Madame Astou (standing at the left in the photo) is responsible for the solidarity group. She is 63 years old, married, and the mother of 9 children. For several years she has been developing a small business trading grains. With her new loan, she will procure merchandise (peanuts and millet) which she will resell at the small market in her village.

With these profits she will be able to pay for her children's school supplies as well as for clothing for religious festivals.

loans.use: to purchase peanuts and millet

loans.name: Ruba

texts.en:
Ruba is a 20-year-old single lady. She has two younger brothers. Her father is a teacher.
Now that Ruba has entered the university, she has chosen to study English literature. She is now in her second year, and would like to continue to get her bachelor's degree and get a master's degree in the same field.
Ruba has applied for a loan to pay for her semester fees.

loans.use: to pay for her semester fees

loans.name: Sadiya

texts.en:
Sadiya is a conservative person, so she asked her son Waheeb to take her place in the photo.
Sadiya is a 64-year-old widow. She has six sons and daughters. One of them is Waheeb, a 33-year-old single man. He is the oldest among the men in the family.
Due to some financial challenges, Waheeb was not able to register to study at the university when he was at a younger age, but he kept working hard until one day, he was accepted to study architecture. Now he is in his second year and is very close to getting a diploma in the major, but he wants to proceed to get a bachelor's degree and work in the same field in order to help in supporting his younger brothers and sisters to get a chance at learning.
Now, Sadiya wants to help her son Waheeb to achieve his goal, so she has applied for a loan to pay for his semester fees.

loans.use: to pay for her son's semester fees.

loans.name: Daifallah

texts.en:
Daifallah is a  23-year-old single guy who is in the fourth year of studying Business Information Systems. 

Daifallah is one of five sons and daughters for Ghaleb and Siham who have worked hard to provide their children with a good life. That’s why Daifallah decided to depend on himself and started to work in a café on specific shifts based on his university schedule. 

Daifallah has applied for this loan to be able to pay for his semester as he has faced money shortage this time.

loans.use: to pay for his semester fees

loans.name: Sandra

texts.es:
Sandra, de 26 años, es una mujer amable, buena y trabajadora, es conviviente con su pareja con quien tiene un hijo de 1 año, todos los días ella trabaja mucho pues desea brindar una mejor calidad de vida a su hijo y a mejorar la economía de su familia, vive en su casa propia con su pareja y su menor hijo. El trabajo de Sandra consiste en la venta de prendas de vestir, si alguien en la cuadra de su casa necesita alguna prenda de vestir para poder asistir a algún evento social o familiar, siempre van en busca de ella que tiene la prenda adecuada para cualquier ocasión. Tiene un pequeño espacio en su casa en donde acondicionó para atender a sus diferentes clientes. Trabaja ya por dos años en éste negocio y lo hace sola ya que así se siente mas cómoda.
Le gusta su negocio pues le permite tener ingresos, al mismo tiempo que tiene espacio para cuidar a su menor hijo, asimismo le hace sentir muy útil ya que aporta en la economía de su hogar. Ella como toda mujer decidida y emprendedora tiene muchos planes a futuro y desea tener una tienda en donde pueda ofrecer las diferentes prendas que tiene de una manera mas cómoda y con mayor acceso al público. Este será el segundo crédito con MFP, por tanto espera de su colaboración para continuar con sus objetivos, por otro lado se compromete una vez mas de cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas como en anteriores créditos que tuvo, además le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque todos sus integrantes son personas que son responsables y muy solidarias. Con el monto solicitado 1000 soles, comprará más prendas de vestir pues desea siempre tener en stock por si algún cliente necesite, además de tener todo a la moda. También se comprará una maquina de coser ya que desea empezar a coser sus propios diseños.
texts.en:
26-year-old Sandra is a nice, kind, hard-working woman.  She lives with her partner and the couple have a 1-year-old son.  Every day, Sandra works hard as she would like to provide her son with a better quality of life and improve her family's financial situation.  She lives in her own home together with her partner and son.

Sandra's business is selling clothing.  If anybody on her block needs to buy any clothing to attend a social or family event, they always seek her out because she has suitable garments for any occasion.  She has a small space in her house which she set up to serve her customers in.  Sandra has been in this business for two years now and works alone as she feels more comfortable that way.  She enjoys her business because it makes her income and also allows her to care for her son.  At the same time, it makes her feel very useful as she is contributing financially towards her household.  In common with all determined and entrepreneurial women, Sandra has many plans for the future.  She would like to have a store where she can offer the different clothing that she sells in more comfort and with better access to the public.

This will be Sandra's second loan from MFP and she hopes to receive your cooperation so that she can continue achieving her goals.  For her part, she pledges, once again, to make her repayments on time, as she did with her previous loans.  She enjoys being a member of her community bank because all the members are responsible and very supportive people.  Sandra will use the 1,000 soles she has requested to buy more clothing as she would like to always have items in stock in case any customer should need them.  She also likes to ensure her stock is fashionable.  In addition, Sandra will buy a sewing machine as she would like to start sewing her own designs.

loans.use: to buy more clothing and a sewing machine

loans.name: Rocio

texts.es: Rocío, de 43 años, es una mujer muy responsable y trabajadora, tiene muchas ganas de progresar, ella es madre de dos menores hijas con quienes vive en casa propia junto a su esposo con quien lleva varios años de casada. Rocío tiene como trabajo la venta de golosinas y postres y lo realiza en la puerta de su casa, además tiene varios cuartos en su casa los cuales alquila, por lo que significa un ingreso mas para su economía. Lleva en éste trabajo diez años, lo hace en su casa y tiene la ayuda de sus hijas, aunque por el momento la venta de dulces no lo está haciendo muy seguido, pues el clima en la zona no le permite completar exitosamente su venta, pero ella como es una mujer de negocios ya esta viendo la manera de poder generar ganancias con otro tipo de inversión. Lo que mas le gusta de su trabajo es que le da buenos ingresos, además de poder estar en su casa con sus hijas. Ella espera mas adelante mejorar las condiciones de su casa para así alquilar sus cuartos a mejor precio. Este será el tercer cerdito con MFP, está muy contenta de saber que tendrá un apoyo financiero ya que le permitirá estar mas tranquila y avanzar con sus planes de su negocio, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual y sobre todo compenetrarse mas con los integrantes de su banco comunal que son muy solidarios. Con el monto solicitado 1200 soles, comprará materiales para construcción ya que comenzara con la ampliación de sus cuartos y mejorará las condiciones de los mismos.
texts.en:
Rocio, 43 years old, is a responsible, hard working woman who has a great desire to progress. She is the mother of two minor aged daughters who live with her in her own house together with her husband, to whom she has been married to for several years. Rocio works selling sweets and desserts, which she carries out from the door of her house. Also, she has various bedrooms which she rents out in order to have a higher income contributing to her economic situation. 

She has been working in this activity for ten years; she does it at home and has the help of her daughters. However, for the moment she is not carrying out the sales of sweets very regularly, as the climate in the area does not allow her to sell successfully. But as she is a business woman she has already found a way to generate more income with a different type of investment.

What she most enjoys about her work is being able to have a good income as well as being at home with her daughters. She hopes to improve the living conditions in her house in the future in order to rent out her rooms at a better price. This will be her third loan with MFP. She is very happy to know that she will have financial support as this will give her more tranquillity to advance with her plans for her business. She is committed to paying her quotas punctually and above all to associate with the other members of her communal bank as they are very supportive. With the loan amount of 1200 PEN she will buy construction materials as she will begin extending her rooms and improving the conditions they are in.

loans.use: to buy construction materials to prepare more rooms to rent out.

loans.name: Benjamin

texts.es:
Benjamín de 24 años convive con Errobelina con quien tiene 2 hijos: Sheyla de 7 y Yeysi de 3 años de edad. Esta familia vive en una casa propia en la comunidad nativa Inchatingari, distrito de Perené, provincia de Chanchamayo.
Benjamín empezó su vida de padre en la adolescencia todavía con carencias de hogar y dinero. Con el tiempo y el apoyo de sus padres pudo acceder a terrenos de cultivos. Así conformó un hogar y construyó su casa. Actualmente cuenta con 3 parcelas de tierras fértiles, en ellas produce achiote y café.
“En una cosecha tengo 1500 kilos de achiote y del café como 300 kilos”, menciona. Benjamín negocia sus productos al menudeo. Traslada sus frutos hasta la ciudad de Pichanaki, ahí tiene un puesto de ventas donde ofrece el café y achiote por kilos. 
Lleva 5 años en esta actividad. Y confía que, con los años podrá ampliar sus terrenos cultivando otros productos. Además de comercializar al por mayor, ya que los resultados son inmediatos y se evita que los frutos se malogren.
Unos de sus planes es dedicarse a la compra y venta de frutas, que piensa adquirir en su localidad para expenderlas en el mercado mayorista de su distrito. Éste sería su crédito número3 que recibiría de MFP, por eso se compromete a ser puntual en el  pago de las cuotas mensuales. Afirma sentirse respaldado con su banco comunal “Productores de Inchatingari”, porque sus compañeros comparten los mismos planes.
Invertirá el dinero en la compra de herramientas de trabajo como machetes y limas, con las que cultivará sus cafetales. Además pagará a los jornaleros quienes apoyarán en esta ardua labor.
texts.en:
24-year-old Benjamín lives with his partner Errobelina.  The couple have two children: 7-year-old Sheyla and 3-year-old Yeysi.  The family live in their own home in the indigenous community of Inchatingari, in Perené district, in Chanchamayo province.

Benjamín started his life as a father when he was a teenager and still lacked a home and money.  Over time, with the support of his parents, he was able to acquire some farmland.  He formed his household and built a house.  Benjamín currently has three plots of fertile land where he produces annatto and coffee.  "With each harvest I have 1,500 kilos of annatto and 300 kilos of coffee", he says.  Benjamín sells his crops retail.  He transports his fruit to the city of Pichanaki where he has a sales stall.  There he sells his coffee and annatto by the kilo.

Benjamín has been in this business for five years.  He believes that, over the years, he will be able to expand his land and grow other crops.  He will also be able to sell wholesale as the results of this are immediate and you avoid the produce spoiling.  One of Benjamín's plans is to start buying and selling fruit which he will acquire in his town and then sell in the wholesale market in his district.  

This will be Benjamín's third loan from MFP and he pledges to be punctual in making his monthly repayments.  He says that he feels supported by his community bank 'Productores de Inchatingari' because his fellow group members share the same plans as him.  He will invest his money in buying work tools such as machetes and tool sharpeners which he will use on his coffee plantations.  He will also pay the laborers who will support him in this strenuous task.

loans.use: to buy agricultural tools and hire laborers

loans.name: Sonia

texts.es: Sonia, de 50 años, es una mujer muy dinámica y trabajadora, es conviviente y tiene tres hijas quienes ya son mayores y solo dos viven con ella. Tiene una casa propia en donde la comparte con dos de sus hijas y junto a su pareja, además ella tiene a su cargo un nieto de su segunda hija a quien cría y desea brindar una mejor calidad de vida. El trabajo de Sonia consiste en la venta de zapatos, ropas y lencería, se encarga de repartir entre sus amigas, vecinas y familiares. Lleva con éste trabajo ya casi por 22 años, le va bien hasta ahora y tiene la ayuda de su esposo. Le gusta su trabajo ya que puede darse ese tiempo que le faltaba de estar trabajando a lado de su esposo, además de tener tiempo para poder hacer otras cosas mas en su hogar, tiene muchos planes a futuro, desea poder agrandar su negocio, traer mas variedad de productos, y en algún momento tener una tienda en donde los atienda de manera mas cómoda a sus clientes. Este será el crédito número 16 con MFP, está muy contenta de saber que tendrá un apoyo financiero para poder continuar con su trabajo, además está convencida que seguirá siendo una socia responsable de los créditos obtenidos anteriormente. Le gusta pertenecer al banco comunal al que trabaja ya que todos son responsables y muy solidarios entre si. Con el monto solicitado 2500 soles, traerá productos para continuar con su negocio, entre las cosas que comprara están, zapatos, prendas de vestir y lencería de variedad en calidad y diseños.
texts.en:
Sonia, 50 years old, is a hard working, dynamic woman. She lives with her partner and has three adult daughters, two of whom live with her. She has her own house which she shares with two of her daughters and her partner. Also she looks after her grandson, the son of her second oldest daughter, who she raises and hopes to offer a better quality of life. Sonia's work consists of selling shoes, clothing and lingerie. She is responsible for distributing amongst her friends, neighbours and family members. She has worked in this activity for 22 years; it's gone well up 'til now and she has the help of her husband.

She likes her work as it gives her the time she needs to work alongside her husband and also she has time to do other things at home. She has many plans for the future; she hopes to extend her business, bring more variety of products and at some future moment to have a shop where she can serve her customers more comfortably. 

This will be her 16th loan with MFP. She is very happy to know that she will have financial support to continue with her work. Also, she is convinced that she will continue being a responsible member of the previous loans. She likes belonging to her communal bank as they are all responsible and very supportive. With the loan amount of 2500 PEN she will bring products to continue with her business. Among the things she will buy will be shoes, clothing and a variety of designed quality lingerie.

loans.use: to buy shoes, clothing and lingerie.

loans.name: Steffanie

texts.es: Steffanie, de 22 años, es una mujer emprendedora muy joven, es soltera y aun no es madre, vive a lado de sus padres en casa de ellos, en donde también comparte junto a su hermana y su pequeño sobrino quien es la alegría de su casa. Ella trabaja mucho pues desea brindar una mejor calidad de vida a sus padres. El trabajo de Steffanie consiste en la venta de ropa, vende sus productos en su barrio, ahí sus amigos o familiares desea tener un nuevo look, una prenda de buena marca y con diseños innovadores, siempre van en busca de los productos que ella vende, ya que encuentran novedades a buen precio y sobre todo de muy buena calidad. Lleva éste trabajo ya casi dos años y lo hace sola. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es su independencia ya que le permite tener tiempo y espacio para poder hacer sus cosas personales sin descuidar sus ingresos con los que apoya a su familia. Considera su negocio rentable porque vende sus productos a personas que tienen para pagar y sin dudar siempre le compran pues saben que tiene en venta un buen producto. Tiene muchos planes y sueños por cumplir, pero lo que por ahora desea con muchas ganas es poder tener su tienda o un local en donde exhibir y vender sus prendas. Este será el préstamo número 4 con la institución MFP, siempre fue muy buena socia en su banco comunal en donde la quieren mucho por que es muy responsable y solidaria, espera que le puedan brindar el préstamo que será un respaldo para ella y seguir aumentando su negocio, está convencida que seguirá siendo una socia muy puntual y pagará sus cuotas a tiempo como todos los prestamos que tuvo hasta ahora. Con el monto solicitado 1000 soles, comprará mayor variedad de prendas de vestir ya que desea ofrecer mayor variedad y modelos nuevos e innovadores que es lo que le caracteriza.
texts.en:
22-year-old Steffanie is a very young entrepreneur.  She is single and not yet a mother.  She lives in her parent's home together with her parents, sister and her young nephew who fills their home with happiness.  Steffanie works hard because she would like to offer her parents a better quality of life.

Steffanie's business is selling clothing.  She sells her products in her neighborhood.  Friends or family members who would like a new look, clothing from a good brand and the latest designs seek out the products that she sells because she sells the latest, good-quality clothing at a good price.  Steffanie has been in this business for almost two years and she works alone.  What she enjoys about her work is the independence she has as it allows her to have time and space for doing her own thing without neglecting the income she needs to make to support her family.  She considers her business to be profitable because she sells her products to people who have the ability to pay and who never hesitate to buy from her as they know that she sells good products.  Steffanie has many plans and dreams to fulfill but what she would really like right now is to have her own store or a sales location where she can display and sell her clothing.

This will be Steffanie's fourth loan from MFP.  She has always been a very good member of her community bank and her fellow members all like her a lot because she is very responsible and supportive.  She hopes to receive a loan as it will be a support for her and she will be able to continue growing her business.  She is certain that she will continue being a very punctual member and will make her repayments on time like she did with her previous loans.  Steffanie will use the 1,000 soles she has requested to buy a wider variety of clothing as she would like to be able to offer a wider variety and the latest designs as this is what she is known for.

loans.use: to buy more clothing

loans.name: Vilma

texts.es:
Vilma, de 42, es una mujer alegre, amable y carismática, es conviviente con su pareja ya por varios años, es madre de cuatro hijos que ya son mayores. Ella vive en casa de su mamá junto a su pareja y otras seis personas más, trabaja mucho pues desea brindar una mejor calidad de vida a su familia. El trabajo de Vilma consiste en la venta de ropa, tiene los mejores diseños y la mejor calidad siempre en venta, ésta actividad lo hace en su casa y lleva ya trabajando así por casi un año. A veces espera a los clientes en su casa pero hay otras veces que sale a buscarlos entre sus vecinos y amigos. Trabaja sola pues se siente mejor estar así sin tener que rendir cuentas a nadie.
Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que es muy descansado ya que ella ve el tiempo en el que sale a ofrecer y en que momento sale a cobrar, además tiene muy buena cartera de clientes. Tiene grandes planes a futuro, pero lo que mas le interesa es seguir creciendo, ahora está desea vender ropa de segunda y poder ofrecerlos por los diversos caseríos y comunidades de la rivera del río. Este será el quinto préstamo con MFP, por tanto espera de su colaboración para continuar con sus objetivos. Por otro lado se compromete una vez mas de cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas como en anteriores créditos que tuvo, además le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque todos sus integrantes son personas que son responsables y muy solidarias.
Con el monto solicitado 2000 soles, comprará prendas de vestir en mayor cantidad y diseños ya que desea tener a sus clientes siempre a la moda y eso le permite vender más rápido su mercadería.
texts.en:
Vilma is 42 years old. She is a cheerful, kind and charismatic woman. She has lived with her spouse for several years and is the mother of four children who are already grown. She lives in her mother's house with her spouse and six other people. She works a lot because she wants to offer a better quality of life to her family. Vilma's job consists of selling clothes. She has the best designs and the best quality for sale. She does this activity in her house and has been doing it for almost a year.
